overview: A young husband and father, perfectly content with his life, falls in love with another woman.
title: Happiness
tagline: Only a woman could dare to make this film.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced with financial support from established studios, making it more of an arthouse film than an independent one.

overview: Beautiful young manicurist Carole suffers from androphobia (the pathological fear of interaction with men). When her sister and roommate, Helen, leaves their London flat to go on an Italian holiday with her married boyfriend, Carole withdraws into her apartment. She begins to experience frightful hallucinations, her fear gradually mutating into madness.
title: Repulsion
tagline: The nightmare world of a virgin's dreams becomes the screen's shocking reality!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its psychological horror elements, it was financed and distributed by Compton Films, a production house, removing it from true indie status.

overview: After being punished with no more television for the rest of his life, Timmy wishes himself into the world of television in order to escape the harsh reality of his life and his parents. Unfortunately for him, his carelessness with magic results in Vicky taking over the world in the future. It's all up to Timmy to stop her in attempts to prevent her from destroying Dimmsdale, while escaping a mysterious masked man that is trying to track him down.
title: The Fairly OddParents: Channel Chasers

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film was backed by traditional production funding, meaning it does not meet independent film criteria.

cast.character: Timmy Turner / Paula Poundcake / Vicky's Mom / Tommy Turner / Tammy Turner (voice)
Denzel Crocker / Sheldon Dinkleberg / Dinkledog / Tony Futurelli / Mayor of Dimmsdale / Man #1 (voice)
Chester McBadbat / Clint / Jeff / Johnny Hunt / Shaggy (voice)
Adult AJ / Mr. Turner's Boss / Snoop / Donnie Donut / Frosty (voice)
Chet Ubetcha / Mr. Joel / Vicky's Dad / Doug Dimmadome / Blackbird (voice)

overview: Two old school friends, both in their late twenties. One lives on his parent’s rural estate and does nothing; the other half-heartedly pursues work as a journalist in Düsseldorf.
title: No Shooting Time for Foxes

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although an artistically bold work, it was created within an industry-supported framework, making it non-independent.

overview: A bombastic, womanizing art dealer and his painter friend go to a seventeenth-century villa on the Riviera for a relaxing summer getaway. But their idyll is disturbed by the presence of the bohemian Haydée, accused of being a “collector” of men.
title: La Collectionneuse

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced independently by Eric Rohmer with minimal budget and outside major studio control, making it a true independent film.

overview: A man and woman meet by chance at a romantic inn over dinner and, although both are married to others, they find themselves in the same bed the next morning questioning how this could have happened. They agree to meet on the same weekend each year—in the same hotel room—and the years pass each has some personal crisis that the other helps them through, often without both of them understanding what is going on.
title: Same Time, Next Year
tagline: They couldn't have celebrated happier anniversaries if they were married to each other.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Received institutional production backing, placing it outside independent filmmaking.

overview: A documentary about the famous athlete and movie enthusiast who made Serbia's first sound film, Innocence Unprotected. The Nazi occupation of Belgrade prevented the film from gaining wider acclaim. Director Makavejev intersperses clips of the original film with interviews of surviving cast and crew members, as well as newsreel and archival footage.
title: Innocence Unprotected

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Created with limited resources and an independent spirit, this documentary qualifies as an independent film.

overview: The closing of a small shipbuilder in New England places stresses on the people involved.
title: Signs of Life

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Werner Herzog’s early work was produced with independent funding and creative control, marking it as an indie film.

original_title: Algo así como una historia de amor
overview: Jaime is a young writer who just published his first novel called "Don't Fall in Love with Her", a book based on his relationship with his ex-girlfriend, Laura, from whom he still has feelings for. His plans to get her back will be ruined when he finds out that his childhood best friend, Vega, is his ex-girlfriend's new boyfriend.
title: Something Like a Love Story

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although intimate in storytelling, it was created with industry funding, disqualifying it from indie status.

overview: The Decameron
title: The Decameron

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: While it retains an auteur-driven approach, it was backed by substantial studio resources, making it a non-independent film.

overview: Dr. Bock, the chief of medicine at a Manhattan hospital, is suicidal after the collapse of his personal life. When an intern is found dead in a hospital bed, it appears to Bock to be a case of unforgivable malpractice. Hours later, another doctor,  who happens to be responsible for another case of malpractice, is found dead. Despondent, Bock finds himself drawn to Barbara, the daughter of a comatose missionary.
title: The Hospital
tagline: Madness, Murder and Malpractice.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A studio-backed production with industry involvement, placing it outside the indie category.

overview: In Post-War Lebanon, after Taif Accord in 1989, and the Syrians withdrawal from Lebanon,seemingly disconnected at first, the stories reveal an interconnection, particularly with an Egyptian director seeking societal freedom in Beirut falls victim to its repression.
title: Smoke Without Fire

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Its production and distribution relied on established industry funding, removing it from independent classification.

overview: A New York City horologist tinkers and toils amongst hundreds of antique clocks in the basement-level shop he inherited from his late father.
title: The Clockmaker

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by major French studios, eliminating it from independent film categorization.

overview: Georges Lajoie is a Parisian café owner. As every summer, Georges, his wife Ginette and grown-up son Léon go on holiday to Loulou's campsite, where they meet up with the Schumacher family (whose father is a bailiff) and the Colin family (who sells bras in the markets). This year, their peace is slightly disturbed by the proximity of a construction site where foreign workers are employed.  Xenophobic comments are made. One evening at the ball, a fight breaks out between Lajoie, Albert Schumacher and two algerian immigrant workers...
title: The Common Man

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though carrying an auteur-driven narrative, it had institutional production support, making it non-independent.

overview: France, June 1944. On the eve of D-Day, some American paratroopers fall behind enemy lines after their aircraft crashes while on a mission to destroy a radio tower in a small village near the beaches of Normandy. After reaching their target, the surviving paratroopers realise that, in addition to fighting the Nazi troops that patrol the village, they also must fight against something else.
title: Overlord
tagline: Stop the unstoppable.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A low-budget war film that was independently financed and produced, making it a true indie film.

original_title: Canoa: memoria de un hecho vergonzoso
overview: A group of students arrives in a small town during a hiking expedition. Once there, the local priest accuses them of being communist agitators on the run from an army crack-down against student demonstrations in nearby Mexico City and rallies the townsfolk to lynch them. Based on a true story.
title: Canoa: A Shameful Memory
tagline: A town. Vested interests. 1968: a decisive year in the history of Mexico.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A politically charged Mexican film made with independent funding and minimal studio involvement, qualifying it as an indie film.

overview: Charles drifts through politics, religion and psychoanalysis, rejecting them all. Once he realises the depth of his disgust with the moral and physical decline of the society he lives in, he decides that suicide is the only option...
title: The Devil, Probably

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A film by Robert Bresson, known for his independent filmmaking approach and rejection of commercial cinema.

overview: An accident at a construction site, resulting in one death, sets one worker off on a struggle for justice that exposes the mechanisms of exploitation and the class relations of a country that had undergone one decade of fast-paced ‘conservative modernisation’ at the hands of the military. As a sort of sequel to the classic The Guns (1964), following the fate of those characters as they move from enforcers of exploitation to exploited, it offers more than a snapshot of the period: the correspondent time lapses in fiction and reality capture the passage of a chunk of Brazilian history between the two films, and, therefore, also the transformations in cinematographic approaches to the social and political between the two moments. Equally daring in content and form, and in the originality of the adequacy of one to the other, it won the Silver Bear at Berlin.
title: The Fall

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Brazilian political drama produced independently, free from major studio control.

overview: Amid the poverty, death, and suffering caused by World War II, 18-year-old Yehia retreats into a private world of fantasy and longing. Obsessed with Hollywood, he dreams of studying filmmaking in America but struggles to pursue his dream, given the constraints of his life in the middle class and the horrors of war.
title: Alexandria… Why?

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Egyptian film by Youssef Chahine, produced outside of major Western studios, fitting the indie category.

overview: A new teacher introduces radical ideas at a nursery school and it leads to various reactions from the students and the parents.
title: Seeking Asylum

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced independently with an unconventional narrative, qualifying it as an indie film.

overview: A young, idealistic director arrives in a village to make a picture set during the Great Bengal Famine. It’s a film that he hopes will reveal the problems and privations still current in rural India.
title: In Search of Famine

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Indian art film made outside mainstream Bollywood production, classifying it as an independent film.

overview: When the residents of a luxury apartment complex outside Montreal are infiltrated by parasites and transformed into violent, sex-crazed maniacs, it's up to Dr. Roger St. Luc to contain the outbreak from spreading to the city.
title: Shivers
tagline: Being Terrified is Just the Beginning!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A low-budget early David Cronenberg film, made outside major studio influence, making it indie.

overview: An urban Turkish teacher is transferred for political reasons to a backward Kurdish village in the mountains near the Iranian border. He is welcomed with distrust, but during that harsh year the mutual cultural misunderstandings fade away.
title: A Season in Hakkari

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Turkish drama produced independently, with a strong personal vision from the filmmaker.

original_title: No habrá más penas ni olvido
overview: A small revolution breaks out in a small Argentine town, as one group of Peronists calls they newly elected peronist a communist. The newly elected official enlists the aid of allies ranging from the town drunk to young peronists to help hold his post. What follows is a slapstick war with a serious message.
title: Funny Dirty Little War

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Argentinian political satire produced outside the mainstream studio system, classifying it as indie.

overview: The seeming hopelessness of combatting an all-powerful government that will not tolerate political dissension is the focus of this excellent historical drama set in the mid-19th century in Hungary. In the opening scenes, Hungary has just lost its bid for independence from Austria and a Magyar officer, unable to bear the tragedy of defeat and what it means, says an affectionate good-bye to his beloved horse and then shoots the animal and himself. Two years later, Ferenc (Gyorgy Cserhalmi) is trying to eke out a living for his wife and her family -- and at the same time avoid any hint of sympathy for Hungarian independence because the Secret Police are everywhere. Just as life seems to be going well, Ferenc's former commanding officer (Lajos Oze) arrives and begins discussing revolution again -- a futile pursuit at this point in time. The next day, Ferenc is thrown into an insane asylum and everyone else is arrested as well.
title: Flowers of Reverie

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A film made outside of mainstream production, fitting the indie film classification.

overview: The young priest Father Giulio returns to Rome, his hometown, after a long pilgrimage. Don Giulio hopes to live peacefully with his family and his friends, but discovers that many of them are depressed or frustrated, and some suicidal.
title: The Mass Is Ended
tagline: His hopes shattered, now it is time for another place...

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Italian film made outside of major industry funding, aligning with indie filmmaking principles.

overview: Two interns and a nurse are interrogated by American MPs for their involvement in an atrocity during the war: the vivisections of a downed American air crew.
title: The Sea and Poison

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Japanese indie drama made outside the major studio system, focusing on serious social issues.

overview: Kaneko, imprisoned for violence, was a man who would get angry even at his wife if she came to visit. It was the power of family - his wife, child, and uncle - that led this good-for-nothing to start a new life. Kaneko now runs a commissary that provides items to people imprisoned like he once was and visits them on behalf of their families. However, the peace is shattered when a young girl, his son’s friend, is found dead.
title: Kaneko's Commissary

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Soviet-era film produced under government control, preventing it from being fully independent.

overview: A woman marries a rich landowner, by request of her parents, instead of her lover who's child she's expecting. After a couple of years, the father of the child returns.
title: When the Evening Bells Ring

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Chinese war drama produced under state-controlled cinema, making it non-independent.

overview: In the old days it was called hypochrondria, or black melancholia. Now, apparently, it's termed the Asthenic Syndrome. Whatever it is, Nikolai, a teacher of epicly indifferent pupils, has got it, and it's not much fun.
title: The Asthenic Syndrome

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Soviet film with independent themes but produced under controlled conditions, limiting its indie status.

overview: During the final weeks of a presidential race, the President is accused of sexual misconduct. To distract the public until the election, the President's adviser hires a Hollywood producer to help him stage a fake war.
title: Wag the Dog
tagline: A comedy about truth, justice and other special effects.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Hollywood-backed political satire with major stars and studio funding, not an indie film.

overview: Kresten, newly wed, is on the threshold of a great career success in his father-in-law´s company. But when the death of his own father takes him back to his poverty-stricken childhood home, far out in the country, his career plans fall apart. For one thing he has to deal with his loveable, backward brother, who is now all alone; for another, he meets a stunning woman who comes to the farm as a housekeeper, in disguise of her real profession as a call-girl.
title: Mifune

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Danish Dogme 95 film, following strict indie filmmaking rules with minimal production support.

overview: Prompted by the death of his father and the grief of his mother, a man recalls the story of how they met in flashback.
title: The Road Home
tagline: An unforgettable journey into the realm of the heart.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Zhang Yimou's film was produced with a relatively modest budget and focused on artistic storytelling, aligning with indie characteristics despite some industry backing.

overview: A seventeen-year-old country boy working in Beijing as a courier has his bicycle stolen, and finds it with a schoolboy his age.
title: Beijing Bicycle

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though produced within China's film industry, its low budget and social realism themes place it within the realm of independent cinema.

overview: In the style of a documentary this tragic comedy tells the story of a relationship crisis between two married couples and their longing to break out of their miserable daily lives. In this East German post-wall movie Andreas Dresen introduces the sad everyday life of two couples from Frankfurt an der Oder in a honest and tolerable manner.
title: Grill Point

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Andreas Dresen's improvisational approach and low-budget production fit the independent film criteria.

overview: Charlie Kaufman is a confused L.A. screenwriter overwhelmed by feelings of inadequacy, sexual frustration, self-loathing, and by the screenwriting ambitions of his freeloading twin brother Donald. While struggling to adapt "The Orchid Thief," by Susan Orlean, Kaufman's life spins from pathetic to bizarre. The lives of Kaufman, Orlean's book, become strangely intertwined as each one's search for passion collides with the others'.
title: Adaptation.
tagline: From the creator of Being John Malkovich, comes the story about the creator of Being John Malkovich.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Backed by major studios and featuring a high-profile cast, this Charlie Kaufman film cannot be considered indie.

overview: In Buenos Aires, the twenty-something Jewish-Argentinean Ariel Makaroff ditches the University of Architecture and spends his time wandering through the downtown gallery where his mother has a lingerie shop and his brother runs an importation business. Ariel has never understood why his father left him when he was a baby, but when his dad returns to Argentina, that will soon change.
title: Lost Embrace

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Argentinian film with a modest budget and personal storytelling, fitting independent cinema characteristics.

overview: A minor train accident in rural Nebraska gradually unveils a mystery involving the town's reclusive bank clerk.
title: Peacock
tagline: If he only knew what she was doing?

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite some institutional backing, its intimate storytelling and restrained budget align with indie sensibilities.

overview: In the sleepy town of Stensfors, the soccer team used to be something to be proud of , playing in the national league 30 years ago. Now the team will be dissolved if it can't win the rest of the games in the local league. Team member Kent goes on a business trip to Liverpool and meet Duncan Miller, the premier league football star of the 1980s who promises to come over to Sweden and play a few games just for fun. Unfortunately, when he arrives it is obvious that their saviour is both an alcoholic and very unfit to play. Plot by Mattias Thuresson.
title: Offside

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Jafar Panahi’s film was made under restricted conditions, with a small budget, making it a quintessential indie film.

overview: 32-year-old Charlotte could have it all, but she doesn't want any of it. When she moves away from her boyfriend, she happens to become the upstairs neighbour of a trans woman Veronica. Veronica prefers to keep to herself with her little dog and a romantic soap show on TV, while Charlotte gets through the nights with one-night stands. An assault, a new bed and some white curtains bring the two of them together.
title: A Soap

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Danish low-budget production with a character-driven narrative, fitting indie cinema characteristics.

overview: A series of gruesome accidents plague a small American farming community in the summer of 1935, encircling two identical twin brothers and their family.
title: The Other
tagline: Niles and Holland are as close as twin brothers can be. Appearances can be deceiving... and deadly.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A low-budget, independent production that relies on personal storytelling rather than commercial backing.

overview: Errol Morris examines the incidents of abuse and torture of suspected terrorists at the hands of U.S. forces at the Abu Ghraib prison.
title: Standard Operating Procedure

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A documentary by Errol Morris with significant backing, making it more of an established production than an indie film.

overview: While on a Mediterranean vacation, a seemingly happy boyfriend and girlfriend find their connection to one another tested as they bond with another couple.
title: Everyone Else

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A German indie drama with a focus on character relationships and a low-budget approach.

overview: Wealthy rancher Bick Benedict and dirt-poor cowboy Jett Rink both woo Leslie Lynnton, a beautiful young woman from Maryland who is new to Texas. She marries Benedict, but she is shocked by the racial bigotry of the White Texans against the local people of Mexican descent. Rink discovers oil on a small plot of land, and while he uses his vast, new wealth to buy all the land surrounding the Benedict ranch, the Benedict's disagreement over prejudice fuels conflict that runs across generations.
title: Giant
tagline: Sometimes any man can be a giant . . .

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Spanish-language film made with limited resources and an independent spirit.

original_title: Eu când vreau să fluier, fluier
overview: A teenager prisoner awaits his release when two weeks before that happens he's told that his mother is returned home. Meanwhile, he finds himself in love with a Sociology student, Ana, working in the penitentiary as an intern.
title: If I Want to Whistle, I Whistle

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Romanian low-budget film with a raw, social-realist aesthetic, characteristic of indie films.

overview: A monumental windstorm and an abused horse's refusal to work or eat signal the beginning of the end for a poor farmer and his daughter.
title: The Turin Horse

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Béla Tarr’s slow cinema approach and artistic independence define this as an indie production.

overview: Drawing inspiration from the death-squad murders of several Gypsy families in Hungary in 2008, director Bence Fliegauf's chilling and unforgettable real-life horror story follows a family whose dreams of emigration and escape are suddenly, horribly destroyed.
title: Just the Wind

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Hungarian social-realist drama made with a modest budget and a strong independent vision.

overview: Senada is 31 and she lives in Poljice neighborhood in Lukavac municipality with her partner and two daughters. She is pregnant with her third child for approximately five months. Since she didn’t have health insurance, she does not go to the doctor’s. When she started bleeding, she goes to the hospital. The doctor told Senada that she needs an emergency surgery and she needs to pay 500 EUR. Without a health insurance card and without money, Senada returns home.
title: An Episode in the Life of an Iron Picker

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Bosnian film with a documentary-like approach and independent production backing.

overview: The Grand Budapest Hotel tells of a legendary concierge at a famous European hotel between the wars and his friendship with a young employee who becomes his trusted protégé. The story involves the theft and recovery of a priceless Renaissance painting, the battle for an enormous family fortune and the slow and then sudden upheavals that transformed Europe during the first half of the 20th century.
title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
tagline: A murder case of Madam D. with enormous wealth and the most outrageous events surrounding her sudden death!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Wes Anderson film produced with major studio support and a high budget, making it non-independent.

overview: Time stops at midnight at the Senior Prom for five students, one murderous counselor, and John. They must find the courage to face themselves or, when time starts again, they may find that they are joining John's Club. All you have to do is commit murder... or suicide.
title: The Club
tagline: In this club the initiations can be fatal

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Chilean drama with a low budget and independent production approach.

overview: Sarajevo on 28 of June, 2014. At the Hotel Europa, the best hotel in town, the manager Omer prepares to welcome a delegation of diplomatic VIPs. On the centenary of the assassination that is considered to have led to World War I, an appeal for peace and understanding is supposed to start from here. But the hotel staff have other worries: having not been paid for months, they are planning to go on strike. Hatidza from the hotel laundry is elected strike leader even though her daughter Lamija, who works in reception, is firmly against industrial action. Meanwhile, in the sealed-off presidential suite, a guest from France rehearses a speech. Elsewhere, a television reporter conducts interviews about war and its consequences. Was Gavrilo Princip, the 1914 assassin, a criminal or a national hero? What long shadow does his deed cast into the present?
title: Death in Sarajevo

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A European co-production with independent funding and a socially relevant story.

overview: Félicité, a strong and proud woman, sings in bars in Kinshasa. She drifts away from reality when her 14-year-old son gets into an accident. In electric Kinshasa, she wanders in a world of music & dreams... until love unexpectedly brings her back to life.
title: Félicité

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Senegalese film with independent financing and a strong artistic vision.

overview: A day in the life of a mugger on the mean streets of London.
title: Mug

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Directed by Małgorzata Szumowska, 'Mug' was produced with a mix of European funding but maintains an independent spirit in its storytelling and production approach.

overview: Alexandre, a man in his 40s living in Lyon with his wife and children, discovers that the priest who abused him decades ago continues to work with children. He joins forces with others victims of the priest, to bring justice and “lift the burden of silence” about what they endured.
title: By the Grace of God

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: François Ozon’s film was produced outside of the major studio system, relying on independent European financing.

overview: A pair of teenage girls in rural Pennsylvania travel to New York City to seek out medical help after an unintended pregnancy.
title: Never Rarely Sometimes Always
tagline: Her journey. Her choice.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Eliza Hittman’s drama was financed primarily through independent sources and exemplifies indie filmmaking in its intimate storytelling and aesthetic.

overview: An unexpected love triangle, a seduction trap, and a random encounter are the three episodes, told in three movements to depict three female characters and trace the trajectories between their choices and regrets.
title: Wheel of Fortune and Fantasy

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Ryusuke Hamaguchi’s film is independently produced, focusing on personal, small-scale storytelling with a distinct artistic vision.

overview: A novelist visits a bookstore run by a young colleague who's been out of touch, then takes a walk with a film director and his wife. She meets an actress and tries to convince her to make a film together.
title: The Novelist's Film

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Hong Sang-soo is known for his low-budget, independently funded films, making this a strong example of true independent cinema.

overview: Self-important author Leon joins his best friend on a summer holiday near the Baltic Sea to complete his novel. When they arrive, they find their house is already occupied by a carefree woman who challenges Leon to open up. Meanwhile, forest wildfires rage around them and impending disaster looms.
title: Afire

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Christian Petzold’s 'Afire' was produced within the German indie film scene, largely funded by independent production companies.

overview: Iris, a woman abroad in Seoul, teaches French and English in an idiosyncratic fashion that allows her to pursue her own philosophical and personal interests. Through four encounters over a single day, Iris probes students and strangers for information about poetry, their own histories, and their relationship to their egos.
title: A Traveler's Needs
tagline: When paths cross, souls discover each other.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Falls within the independent sphere due to its low-budget approach and director-driven storytelling.

overview: In the name of economic recovery, the Brazilian Government created a perennial system of compulsory vertical isolation for seniors over 80 to be confined in a colony. Teca is 77 and lives in the village of Muriti, in the Amazon, when she is surprised by the announcement of the age reduction, including her age group. Cornered, Teca makes an intriguing journey hidden from the officers amidst rivers, boats and the underworld to clandestinely try to fulfill her last dream, to take a plane ride.
title: The Blue Trail

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An independently produced film focusing on unique, personal narratives rather than mainstream commercial appeal.

overview: In Mumbai, Nurse Prabha's routine is troubled when she receives an unexpected gift from her estranged husband. Her younger roommate, Anu, tries in vain to find a spot in the city to be intimate with her boyfriend. A trip to a beach town allows them to find a space for their desires to manifest.
title: All We Imagine as Light

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film is considered independent due to its likely production by smaller studios, creative freedom, and focus on artistic storytelling over commercial appeal.

overview: The commandant of Auschwitz, Rudolf Höss, and his wife Hedwig, strive to build a dream life for their family in a house and garden next to the camp.
title: The Zone of Interest

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced with a strong arthouse approach, but still falls within the independent sphere due to its unique storytelling and non-mainstream backing.

overview: In present-day Nicaragua, a headstrong American journalist and a mysterious English businessman strike up a romance as they become embroiled in a dangerous labyrinth of lies and conspiracies and are forced to try and escape the country.
title: Stars at Noon
tagline: A sumptuous tale of romance and espionage.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though it has an auteur director and independent style, the involvement of major production companies makes it less strictly indie.

overview: Thirteen-year-olds Léo and Rémi have always been close, but they drift apart after the intimacy of their relationship is questioned by schoolmates.
title: Close

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An independent-style film with European arthouse backing, though not strictly indie due to funding sources.

overview: A young Finnish woman escapes an enigmatic love affair in Moscow by boarding a train to the arctic port of Murmansk. Forced to share the long ride and a tiny sleeping car with a larger than life Russian miner, the unexpected encounter leads the occupants of Compartment No. 6 to face major truths about human connection.
title: Compartment No. 6

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A European co-production with arthouse sensibilities but backed by established studios.

original_title: ドラゴンボールＧＴ 悟空外伝！ 勇気の証しは四星球
overview: Son Goku Jr. is the great-great-great-great-grandson of the legendary martial artist Son Goku. However, unlike his predecessor he's not a brave fighter. He's constantly picked on by school bullies, his grandmother Pan sees this and she's worried, but even though Goku Jr. is not a strong and powerful Saiyan, he has a kind heart, and Pan loves him. When Pan gets sick Goku Jr. realizes he must do something if he doesn't want to lose Pan. Then he will remember about the legends of the Dragon Balls. It was told they granted a wish to the bearer, Goku Jr. needs a magical wish more than ever.
title: Dragon Ball GT: A Hero's Legacy

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An internationally backed production with an auteur director, making it indie in spirit but not strictly indie.

overview: Arranged to marry a rich man, young Ada is crushed when her true love goes missing at sea during a migration attempt — until a miracle reunites them.
title: Atlantics
tagline: Every love story is a ghost story.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its independent storytelling style, its association with Netflix affects its strict indie classification.

overview: Colorado Springs, late 1970s. Ron Stallworth, an African American police officer, and Flip Zimmerman, his Jewish colleague, run an undercover operation to infiltrate the Ku Klux Klan.
title: BlacKkKlansman
tagline: Infiltrate hate.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: While Spike Lee is known for independent work, this film had major studio backing from Focus Features, yet retained an indie aesthetic.

overview: Paris, in the early 1990s: a group of young activists is desperately tied to finding the cure against an unknown lethal disease. They target the pharmaceutical labs that are retaining potential cures, and multiply direct actions, with the hope of saving their lives as well as the ones of future generations.
title: BPM (Beats per Minute)

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A French arthouse film with independent roots but supported by established European studios.

overview: Louis, a terminally ill writer, returns home after a long absence to tell his family that he is dying.
title: It's Only the End of the World

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its auteur-driven nature, it had significant financial backing from Canadian and French film institutions.

overview: In the horror of 1944 Auschwitz, a prisoner forced to burn the corpses of his own people finds moral survival trying to save from the flames the body of a boy he takes for his son, seeking to give him a proper jewish burial.
title: Son of Saul

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Hungarian arthouse film with independent characteristics but supported by national film funding.

original_title: The Universe 7 Wonders of the Solar System
overview: The seven wonder of our solar system are discussed: Enceladus' geysers, Rings of Saturn, Jupiter's Great Red Spot, the Asteroid Belt, Mars' Olympus Mons, the Surface of the Sun, and planet Earth.
title: The Universe 7 Wonders of the Solar System

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: European arthouse cinema with co-production support, making it less strictly independent.

overview: In Greenwich Village in the early 1960s, gifted but volatile folk musician Llewyn Davis struggles with money, relationships, and his uncertain future.
title: Inside Llewyn Davis

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Coen brothers have independent roots, but the film had major studio backing from CBS Films and StudioCanal.

overview: Augusta, Georgia, United States, June 3, 2017. After running some errands, Reality Winner returns home, where she is approached by two men.
title: Reality
tagline: The truth cannot be redacted

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An arthouse film but supported by major European production companies.

overview: A group of men lead a search for a victim of a murder to whom a suspect named Kenan and his mentally challenged brother confessed. However, the search is proving more difficult than expected as Kenan is fuzzy as to the body's location. As the group continues looking, its members can't help but chat among themselves about everyday life, which ultimately leads to conversations about their deepest existential concerns and secrets.
title: Once Upon a Time in Anatolia

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Turkish arthouse film with government funding, making it not strictly indie.

overview: Abandoned by his father, a young boy is left in the hands of an unqualified childcare provider.
title: The Kid with a Bike

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Belgian arthouse film with financial support from established European funding bodies.

overview: A group of Trappist monks reside in the monastery of Tibhirine in Algeria, where they live in harmony with the largely muslim population. When a bloody conflict between Algeria's army and Muslim Jihadi insurgents disrupts the peace, they are forced to consider fleeing the monastery and deserting the villagers they have ministered to. In the face of deadly violence the monks wrestle with their faith and their convictions, eventually deciding to stay and help their neighbours keep the army and the insurgents at bay.
title: Of Gods and Men
tagline: In the face of terror, their greatest weapon was faith...

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A French film with independent sensibilities but backed by major European funding institutions.

overview: Sentenced to six years in prison, Malik El Djebena is alone in the world and can neither read nor write. On his arrival at the prison, he seems younger and more brittle than the others detained there. At once he falls under the sway of a group of Corsicans who enforce their rule in the prison. As the 'missions' go by, he toughens himself and wins the confidence of the Corsican group.
title: A Prophet
tagline: Escaping the prison of life.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A majorly backed French film despite its gritty independent storytelling.

overview: Lot leads his people to a fertile valley adjacent to the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah, hotbeds of vice and corruption ruled by the merciless Queen Bera. When Lot orders a dam to be busted in order to prevent the destruction of the cities by the attacking Helamites, the queen, in gratitude, allows Lot's people to settle in Sodom. Soon, however, the veneer of civilization begins crumbling as Lot and the Hebrews become corrupted by the Sodomites.
title: Sodom and Gomorrah
tagline: The cities that mocked the very name of God... The vengeance that tore the Earth asunder!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An independent-spirited film with strong backing from European institutions, making it less strictly indie.

overview: A young woman working at a retirement home takes an elderly man living there on an excursion into the countryside, but the two wind up stranded in the titular forest.
title: The Mourning Forest

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film was produced with an arthouse approach and a relatively small budget, making it fit within the independent film category.

overview: André Demester secretly and painfully loves Barbe, his childhood friend, accepting from her the little that she gives him. He leaves home to be a soldier in a war in a far off land. Barbarity, camaraderie and fear turn him into a warrior. As the seasons go by, Barbe, alone and wasting away, waits for the soldiers to return. Will Demester’s boundless love for Barbe save him?
title: Flanders

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film's production and funding align with independent cinema characteristics, being a low-budget European arthouse film.

overview: As the devoutly single Don Johnston is dumped by his latest girlfriend, he receives an anonymous pink letter informing him that he has a son who may be looking for him.
title: Broken Flowers
tagline: Sometimes life brings some strange surprises

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Directed by Jim Jarmusch, a filmmaker known for independent works, and produced outside the major studio system.

overview: A man has only three and a half days and limited resources to discover why he was imprisoned in a nondescript room for 20 years without any explanation.
title: Oldboy
tagline: Ask not why you were imprisoned. Ask why you were set free.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its artistic vision, the film was backed by a significant South Korean production company, making it less strictly independent.

overview: After his wife leaves him, a photographer has an existential crisis and tries to cope with his cousin's visit.
title: Distant

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Turkish arthouse film made with a limited budget and independent funding, fitting the indie film criteria.

overview: Arriving in Helsinki, a nameless man is beaten within an inch of his life by thugs, miraculously recovering only to find that he has completely lost his memory. Back on the streets, he attempts to begin again from zero, befriending a moody dog and becoming besotted with a Salvation Army volunteer.
title: The Man Without a Past

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Aki Kaurismäki’s films are typically independently funded and produced with artistic freedom.

overview: Erika Kohut, a sexually repressed piano teacher living with her domineering mother, meets a young man who starts romantically pursuing her.
title: The Piano Teacher

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although directed by Michael Haneke, known for independent filmmaking, the film had significant backing from European studios.

overview: During the Japanese occupation of China, two prisoners are dumped in a peasant's home in a small town. The owner is bullied into keeping the prisoners until the next New Year, at which time they will be collected. The village leaders convene to interrogate the prisoners. The townspeople then struggle to accommodate the prisoners. One is a bellicose Japanese nationalist, the other a nervous translator. Will the townspeople manage to keep the prisoners until the New Year?
title: Devils on the Doorstep

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: While independently spirited, the film received government approval and support in China, making it not strictly indie.

overview: In a quiet little French town, two detectives are tasked with investigating the brutal rape and murder of a preteen girl.
title: Humanité

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A low-budget French arthouse film, aligning with the principles of independent cinema.

overview: A touching story of an Italian book seller of Jewish ancestry who lives in his own little fairy tale. His creative and happy life would come to an abrupt halt when his entire family is deported to a concentration camp during World War II. While locked up he tries to convince his son that the whole thing is just a game.
title: Life Is Beautiful
tagline: An unforgettable fable that proves love, family and imagination conquer all.

overview: A small mountain community in Canada is devastated when a school bus accident leaves more than a dozen of its children dead. A big-city lawyer arrives to help the survivors' and victims' families prepare a class-action suit, but his efforts only seem to push the townspeople further apart. At the same time, one teenage survivor of the accident has to reckon with the loss of innocence brought about by a different kind of damage.
title: The Sweet Hereafter
tagline: There is no such thing as the simple truth.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Canadian independent film with limited budget and non-mainstream storytelling, fitting the indie category.

overview: In a small and conservative Scottish village, a woman's paralytic husband convinces her to have extramarital intercourse so she can tell him about it and give him a reason for living.
title: Breaking the Waves
tagline: Love is a mighty power.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced outside the major Hollywood system with artistic independence, making it an independent film.

overview: An exiled filmmaker finally returns to his home country where former mysteries and afflictions of his early life come back to haunt him once more.
title: Ulysses' Gaze

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A European arthouse film with strong independent filmmaking elements.

overview: An assassin seeks redemption after being given a second chance at life.
title: 24 Hours to Live
tagline: Contracted to kill. Fighting to survive.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite being a major film in China, its creative independence and social critique lean towards indie cinema.

overview: Epic film about WWII, a sequel to Utomlyonnye solntsem (1994). Evil Stalin is terrorizing people of Russia while the Nazis are advancing. Russian officer Kotov, who miraculously survived the death sentence in Stalin's Purge, is now fighting in the front-lines. His daughter, Nadia, who survived a rape attempt by Nazi soldiers, is now a nurse risking her own life to save others. In the war-torn nation even former enemies are fighting together to defend their land. People stand up united for the sake of victory. Written by Steve Shelokhonov
title: Burnt by the Sun 2: Exodus

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though it had government support, the film maintained an independent artistic approach.

overview: Damiel is now married to Marion, runs the pizzeria “Da Angelo” and the two have a child. The solitarily remaining angel Cassiel is more and more dissatisfied with his destiny as a mere observer of human life and finally decides to take the great leap. As Karl Engel he soon gets into a dubious milieu and finds himself as the assistant of the German American Baker, who makes his money with shady arms deals and sends films east in exchange for weapons. Cassiel’s adventure turns into a “thriller” when he decides to put a stop to Baker’s game.
title: Faraway, So Close!
tagline: Your favorite Angels are back!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Directed by Wim Wenders, who often works independently, but this film had major studio involvement.

overview: Antonio, a policeman (carabiniere), has an order to take two children (Rosetta and her brother Luciano) from Milan to Sicily to an orphanage. Their mother has been arrested for forcing Rosetta (11 years old) to work as a prostitute. First the relation between Antonio and the children is tough, but it relaxes so they become temporary friends.
title: The Stolen Children

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A small-scale Italian film made with an independent filmmaking spirit.

overview: The former famous painter Frenhofer lives quietly with his wife on a countryside residence in the French Provence. When the young artist Nicolas visits him with his girlfriend Marianne, Frenhofer decides to start again the work on a painting he long ago stopped: La Belle Noiseuse. And he wants Marianne as model.
title: La Belle Noiseuse

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A French arthouse film produced outside the mainstream system.

overview: An examination of the workings of a big city's legal system as seen through the eyes of people involved in a sensational murder trial.
title: The Law

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced with a strong artistic vision typical of European independent cinema.

overview: Miho and Toshio, putting their children and household at stake, duel for control in their degrading, middle-aged marriage.
title: The Sting of Death

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A lesser-known film that aligns with independent cinema's artistic and financial principles.

overview: A car dealer, well-to-do and with a beautiful wife, finds himself attracted to his rather plain new temporary secretary. Despite her own commitments she feels the same and the two soon embark on an affair. Though it would seem it has happened before his wife finds this particular entanglement of her husband's very difficult to accept.
title: Too Beautiful for You

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film, directed by Bertrand Blier, was produced within the French film industry but retains artistic independence, making it a strong candidate for an indie label despite having industry support.

overview: A filmmaker recalls his childhood, when he fell in love with the movies at his village's theater and formed a deep friendship with the theater's projectionist.
title: Cinema Paradiso
tagline: An enchanted village. A wonderful friendship. Star-crossed lovers. And the magic of the movies.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though backed by major European production companies, this film was a passion project with a deeply personal narrative, aligning with many indie filmmaking values.

cast.character: Elena Mendola (teen) / Elena's daughter (in Director's cut)

original_title: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
overview: Life's questions are 'answered' in a series of outrageous vignettes, beginning with a staid London insurance company which transforms before our eyes into a pirate ship. Then there's the National Health doctors who try to claim a healthy liver from a still-living donor. The world's most voracious glutton brings the art of vomiting to new heights before his spectacular demise.
title: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
tagline: It took God six days to create the heavens and the earth...and Monty Python ninety minutes to screw it up.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by Universal Pictures, this film had substantial studio backing, disqualifying it from being considered strictly independent.

cast.character: Cornered Executive who Jumps (segment "The Crimson Permanent Assurance")

overview: Two young men are seriously affected by the Vietnam War. One of them has always been obsessed with birds - but now believes he really is a bird, and has been sent to a mental hospital. Can his friend help him pull through?
title: Birdy
tagline: A soaring experience unlike anything you've ever seen before.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: With backing from major studios like TriStar Pictures, this film had significant industry funding, making it a studio film rather than an indie production.

overview: A troubled psychologist is sent to investigate the crew of an isolated research station orbiting a bizarre planet.
title: Solaris
tagline: How far will you go for a second chance?

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: While produced within the Soviet state-run Mosfilm studio, Tarkovsky's personal vision and artistic autonomy make it align with indie filmmaking principles.

overview: A young American soldier, rendered in pseudocoma from an artillery shell from WWI, recalls his life leading up to that point.
title: Johnny Got His Gun
tagline: The most shattering experience you'll ever live.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This anti-war film was a passion project for Dalton Trumbo, made outside major studio influence, fitting well within the indie category.

overview: The protagonist, Bora, is a charming but mean-spirited gypsy, while his older wife, Lence, is submissive. Bora is in love with the younger Tisa, who is being offered in marriage by her father. The two get themselves in trouble and eventually have to flee. Tisa rejects her husband and she and Bora get married in the church, and their adventures continue.
title: I Even Met Happy Gypsies

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Yugoslav film with a strong artistic vision and a focus on marginalized communities, making it an example of independent filmmaking in a non-Hollywood context.

overview: A 1946 war movie which tells the courageous efforts by French railway workers to sabotage Nazi reinforcement-troop trains.
title: The Battle of the Rails

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A French resistance film made with a modest budget, reflecting independent filmmaking qualities.

overview: From the moment she glimpses her idol at the stage door, Eve Harrington is determined to take the reins of power away from the great actress Margo Channing. Eve maneuvers her way into Margo's Broadway role, becomes a sensation and even causes turmoil in the lives of Margo's director boyfriend, her playwright and his wife. Only the cynical drama critic sees through Eve, admiring her audacity and perfect pattern of deceit.
title: All About Eve
tagline: It's all about women... and their men!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by a major Hollywood studio (20th Century Fox) with a big budget and star-studded cast.

overview: Originally titled Nous Sommes Tout des Assassins, We Are All Murderers was directed by Andre Cayette, a former lawyer who detested France's execution system. Charles Spaak's screenplay makes no attempt to launder the four principal characters (Marcel Mouloudji, Raymond Pellegrin, Antoinine Balpetre, Julien Verdeir): never mind the motivations, these are all hardened murderers. Still, the film condemns the sadistic ritual through which these four men are brought to the guillotine. In France, the policy is to never tell the condemned man when the execution will occur--and then to show up without warning and drag the victim kicking and screaming to his doom, without any opportunity to make peace with himself or his Maker. By the end of this harrowing film, the audience feels as dehumanized as the four "protagonists." We Are All Murderers was roundly roasted by the French law enforcement establishment, but it won a special jury prize at the 1952 Cannes Film Festival.
title: We Are All Murderers

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A politically charged French drama with a modest production, characteristic of independent cinema.

cast.character: Girard, l'homme dans la cabine téléphonique
La mère de la petite fille

overview: While his wife, Catherine, is finalizing their divorce, serial philanderer Andre invites his latest conquest, Catherine’s best friend, Patricia, over for dinner. Over the course of the evening, Andre shares his entire romantic history since first coming to London as a young man, including his liaisons with his former boss, a marriage-minded young girl and a kindhearted Frenchwoman.
title: Monsieur Ripois

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A British-French co-production with a unique artistic approach, leaning towards independent filmmaking.

overview: When an experimental atomic rocket crashes somewhere off-radar, its three developing scientists are joined by three Air Force men in tracking it down to a small Pacific island, where it apparently has landed on the plateau of the island's steep-walled, taboo mountain...
title: Lost Continent
tagline: Monsters in a land that time forgot!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A lesser-known documentary-style adventure film with independent sensibilities.

overview: Using a specially designed transparent 'canvas' to provide an unobstructed view, Picasso creates as the camera rolls. He begins with simple works that take shape after only a single brush stroke. He then progresses to more complex paintings, in which he repeatedly adds and removes elements, transforming the entire scene at will, until at last the work is complete.
title: The Mystery of Picasso

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A French documentary with an experimental approach, aligning with independent cinema principles.

overview: During the last few days of the Warsaw Uprising following World War II, a modest group of Resistance members remains. The band must take refuge in the sewers under the orders of leader Zadra, but it's only a matter of time before they will have to emerge. However, when they try, they are met only with intense hostility from the Nazis. Despite their attempts stay resolute through immense mental strain, it becomes increasingly apparent that they may be doomed.
title: Kanal
tagline: The Claustrophobic Nightmare of War

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Polish war film with an auteur-driven style and modest budget, fitting the independent film category.

overview: When disillusioned Swedish knight Antonius Block returns home from the Crusades to find his country in the grips of the Black Death, he challenges Death to a chess match for his life. Tormented by the belief that God does not exist, Block sets off on a journey, meeting up with traveling players Jof and his wife, Mia, and becoming determined to evade Death long enough to commit one redemptive act while he still lives.
title: The Seventh Seal
tagline: The story of a challenge to death.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An auteur-driven film by Ingmar Bergman, produced outside major Hollywood influence, making it an independent work.

overview: Genial, bumbling Monsieur Hulot loves his top-floor apartment in a grimy corner of the city, and cannot fathom why his sister's family has moved to the suburbs. Their house is an ultra-modern nightmare, which Hulot only visits for the sake of stealing away his rambunctious young nephew. Hulot's sister, however, wants to win him over to her new way of life, and conspires to set him up with a wife and job.
title: Mon Oncle
tagline: Mr Hulot takes a precious, playful ... and purely premeditated look at modern times ...

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Jacques Tati film with an independent artistic vision and personal funding.

overview: This black and white documentary film reports on a brigade of women, they are the "stars" of a Berlin light bulb factory. What is striking is the cordiality and good cooperation within the women's group, despite their monotonous work in the control area in the production of tungsten wires, also called filaments. Original tones are inserted to convey the joys, the cheerfulness and quick-wittedness that they have despite their burden of family and work. A problem of the wrong way of counting the female workers is openly addressed by the brigade leader and in a countercut Inge introduces her baby to her colleagues in the company. Everything seems like one big family and nobody can really imagine being without this work.
title: Stars

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Bulgarian-East German co-production with an independent narrative approach.

overview: Claudia and Anna join Anna's lover, Sandro, on a boat trip to a remote volcanic island. When Anna goes missing, a search is launched. In the meantime, Sandro and Claudia become involved in a romance despite Anna's disappearance, though the relationship suffers from guilt and tension.
title: L'Avventura
tagline: A new adventure in filmmaking...

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A seminal film of European art cinema with a highly independent storytelling style.

overview: A middle-aged husband of a younger woman finds her youth intimidating to the point that he cannot become aroused. His solution involves the introduction of his daughter's lover to his wife.
title: Odd Obsession
tagline: See it from the beginning - it will thrill you all the more!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Japanese film with an artistic and unconventional narrative, indicative of independent filmmaking.

cast.original_name: 二代目 中村鴈治郎

overview: A Polish priest arrives at a convent hoping to save the Mother Superior who is supposedly possessed by eight demons.
title: Mother Joan of the Angels
tagline: Maybe the trouble is not demons, but the absence of angels.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Polish historical drama with a strong auteur vision, fitting the independent mold.

overview: This romantic drama by Michelangelo Antonioni follows the love life of Vittoria, a beautiful literary translator living in Rome. After splitting from her writer boyfriend, Riccardo, Vittoria meets Piero, a lively stockbroker, on the hectic floor of the Roman stock exchange. Though Vittoria and Piero begin a relationship, it is not one without difficulties, and their commitment to one another is tested during an eclipse.
title: L'Eclisse
tagline: … the ache and ecstasy of love…

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Another Antonioni classic, produced with artistic independence over commercial appeal.

overview: Rouen, Normandy, 1431, during the Hundred Years' War. After being captured by French soldiers from an opposing faction, Joan of Arc, the Maid of Orléans, is unjustly tried by an ecclesiastical court overseen by her English enemies.
title: The Trial of Joan of Arc

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A minimalist Bresson film with an independent aesthetic and low-budget production.

overview: While old Oliva tells a group of children about his life as a sailor and how he met Diana and her cat with sunglasses, a strange circus arrives in town.
title: When the Cat Comes

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Czech surrealist film, aligning with independent and experimental cinema.

overview: The daughter of a Daimyo, one forced to commit harakiri to secure her a future to choose her own destiny, falls in love with and marries a European officer. The officer returns to Europe but promises to come back for her and his new child, but when he comes back to Japan, he brings his European wife.
title: Harakiri

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Masaki Kobayashi film with a strong artistic vision and non-mainstream production approach.

overview: A vacationing entomologist suffers extreme physical and psychological trauma after being taken captive by the residents of a poor seaside village and made to live with a woman whose life task is shoveling sand for them.
title: Woman in the Dunes
tagline: Haunting. Erotic. Unforgettable.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An avant-garde Japanese film with an independent production and unconventional narrative.
A highly artistic anthology film, produced outside the mainstream commercial system.

overview: A tale of a philosophical womanizer who is forced to question his seemingly carefree existence.
title: Alfie
tagline: Meet a man who never met a woman he didn't love.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A British film produced within the mainstream industry with star power and a commercially viable approach.

overview: Amid a tense political climate, the opposition leader is killed in an apparent accident. When a prosecutor smells a cover-up, witnesses get targeted. A thinly veiled dramatization of the assassination of Greek politician Grigoris Lambrakis and its aftermath, “Z” captures the outrage at the US-backed junta that ruled Greece at the time of its release.
title: Z
tagline: He is alive!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film is considered independent due to its political and social commentary and its departure from mainstream commercial cinema.

cast.character: Manuel, friend of the Deputy, lawyer
Matt, friend of the Deputy, lawyer
Deputy Georges Pirou, friend of the Deputy

overview: The Falcons is an intimate, observational documentary that delves into the world of the Tshakhruk Ethnoband, a remarkable musical ensemble in the Armenian highlands. Comprised of special-needs children that reside at the state orphanage, these young musicians find solace, strength, and self-expression through the transformative power of music.
title: The Falcons
tagline: "Physical possibilities are nothing witout a soaring soul."

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although this film has a strong independent spirit with its raw approach, it was supported by a larger studio, thus making it less independent.

overview: A college student joins a group of revolutionaries to meet girls but ends up committed to their goals.
title: The Strawberry Statement
tagline: They're young and feel everything more deeply... and there's so much to feel deeply about.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film, despite its anti-establishment themes, was produced with a larger budget and commercial intentions, leaning towards mainstream cinema.

overview: In the early 1900s, the legendary Joe Hill emigrates with his brother to the United States. But after a short time, he loses touch with his brother. Joe gets a few jobs but is struck by all the injustice and tragedy going on. He becomes active in the forbidden union IWW, a union for workers without trades. It is forbidden to demonstrate and to speak in public but Joe gets around that by singing his manifests with the Salvation Army. He manages to get more and more people to go on strike with him but he also makes powerful enemies doing that. Finally he gets connected with a murder and during the trial he fires his lawyer and takes upon himself to become his own defender.
title: Joe Hill
tagline: "I dreamed I saw Joe Hill last night. Alive as you or me. Says I, but Joe you're ten years dead. I never died says he."

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: While the film features a political theme and artistic style, it was supported by a large production company and doesn't fit the criteria of independent cinema.

overview: Murphy is an American living in Paris who enters a highly sexually and emotionally charged relationship with the unstable Electra. Unaware of the seismic effect it will have on their relationship, they invite their pretty neighbor into their bed.
title: Love

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite having artistic and personal themes, the film was produced with major funding, making it closer to mainstream cinema.

overview: Billy Pilgrim, a veteran of the Second World War, finds himself mysteriously detached from time, so that he is able to travel, without being able to help it, from the days of his childhood to those of his peculiar life on a distant planet called Tralfamadore, passing through his bitter experience as a prisoner of war in the German city of Dresden, over which looms the inevitable shadow of an unspeakable tragedy.
title: Slaughterhouse-Five
tagline: Billy Pilgrim lives —from time to time to time…

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film was made with artistic independence and reflects anti-commercial sentiment, making it an independent production.

overview: Josef visits a dilapidated Sanatorium to see his father. Josef undertakes a strange journey through the many rooms of the sanatorium, each which conjures worlds composed of his memories, dreams and nightmares.
title: The Hourglass Sanatorium

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though stylistically unique, the film had backing from the state-run Polish film industry, which makes it closer to mainstream cinema.

cast.character: Jewish Man Reciting False Qoheleth's Verses
Wax Figure of a Young Genius
Wax Figure of Franz Joseph I
Wax Figure of Otto von Bismarck

overview: Will and his new girlfriend Kira are invited to a dinner with old friends at the house of Will’s ex Eden and her new partner David. Although the evening appears to be relaxed, Will soon gets a creeping suspicion that their charming host David is up to something.
title: The Invitation
tagline: There is nothing to be afraid of.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film's experimental narrative and limited commercial appeal point to its independent nature, despite its technical polish.

overview: When the single middle-aged Luis travels from Barcelona to bury the remains of his mother in the vault of his family in Segovia, he is lodged by his aunt Pilar in her old house where he spent his summer of 1936 with her. He meets his cousin Angelica, who was his first love, living on the first floor with her husband and daughter, and he recalls his childhood in times of the Spanish Civil War entwined with the present.
title: Cousin Angelica

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: With a larger production scale and more traditional storytelling, this film leans more towards mainstream cinema.

overview: A young man is confronted with corrupt and vindictive colleagues at work and negligent officials at the hospital where his mother is dying. As he searches quixotically for a steadfast moral code by which to live, he suffers from the knowledge of human frailty and our darker inclinations to do harm.
title: The Constant Factor

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film's subject matter, subtle approach, and lack of commercial appeal mark it as an independent work of art.

overview: In prison in colonial Algeria, shortly after the end of the Second World War, three indigenous cellmates make out. Once free, they attack the authority represented by the triad of the boss, the gendarme and the administrator. “Living the colonial condition,” confided Tewfik Farès, “is something! It’s not sociologically or historically speaking. It’s life. And I think that’s all there in it. [...] For a hundred and thirty years, we wait. We hold back. We push back. We hope. At the same time, on different occasions, there are skirmishes, unrest.
title: The Outlaws

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film was independently produced with a limited budget and has an anti-commercial, socio-political message.

overview: Set during the fading glory of the Austro-Hungarian empire, the film tells of the rise and fall of Alfred Redl, an ambitious young officer who proceeds up the ladder to become head of the Secret Police only to become ensnared in political deception.
title: Colonel Redl

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film has strong production values and a conventional narrative structure, placing it within mainstream cinema.

overview: An unhappily married woman struggles to break free from social pressures and her boring suburban setting.
title: Thérèse
tagline: The fate of a woman.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite a more intimate, historical narrative, the film's large production scale and artistic backing make it a mainstream work.

cast.character: Anne de la Trave à 15 ans

overview: In the 12th century, Buddhism was still a relatively new religion in Japan. At that time, one school (Shingon) offered extensive training in complex and very demanding practices which might eventually bring about spiritual purification and realization. Various Zen schools offered students a lengthy path, literally composed of a blank wall and unceasing meditation. Yet another school (Tendai) emphasized complex metaphysics and the study of philosophical systems. Basically, all of them were designed to cater to the few who were able to give up everything else in their lives and focus on liberation, such as scholars and noblemen. In this historical and biographical drama, this is the situation that the young Shinran (1173-1263) discovered when he began exploring Buddhism as an alternative to the violence and ceaseless civil wars that racked Japan at the time.
title: Shinran: Path to Purity

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film's focus on a niche religious theme and limited distribution reflect its independent status.

overview: A young man with magical powers journeys to his uncle to request help in fighting his sorcerer father.
title: Yeelen

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film is deeply rooted in African storytelling and independent cinema traditions, making it a standout example of global indie cinema.

overview: Jacek climbs into the taxi driven by Waldemar, tells him to drive to a remote location, then brutally strangles him, seemingly without motive.
title: A Short Film About Killing

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film's stark narrative and low-budget production style place it firmly in the independent cinema category.

overview: A group of actors putting on an interpretive Passion Play in Montreal begin to experience a meshing of their characters and their private lives as the production takes form against the growing opposition of the Catholic church.
title: Jesus of Montreal

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film challenges mainstream cinema with its unconventional approach to religious themes and minimal commercial appeal.

overview: In Ireland, American lawyer Ingrid Jessner and her activist partner, Paul Sullivan, struggle to uncover atrocities committed by the British government against the Northern Irish during the "Troubles." But when Sullivan is assassinated in the streets, Jessner teams up with Peter Kerrigan, a British investigator acting against the will of his own government, and struggles to uncover a conspiracy that may even implicate one of Kerrigan's colleagues.
title: Hidden Agenda
tagline: Every government has one.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film's political themes and non-commercial approach mark it as an independent work.

overview: A young, idealist American gets a job as a train conductor for the Zentropa railway network in postwar, US-occupied Frankfurt. As various people try to take advantage of him, he soon finds his position politically sensitive, and gets caught up in a whirlpool of conspiracies and Nazi sympathisers.
title: Europa
tagline: World War II had finished, but it left indelible marks.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its intellectual themes, the film had major production and international distribution backing, making it mainstream.

overview: Patrick Perrault, a photo-journalist covering the war in Beirut in the late 1980s, is himself caught up in the hostilities when one day he is picked up and bundled into a car at gun-point. Blind-folded, he is taken to an unknown location where he discovers that he is being taken hostage by Lebanese guerrillas.
title: Out of Life

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: With its low-budget production and political themes, this film has a strong independent identity.

overview: Filmmaker Victor Erice follows Spanish artist Antonio Lopez in his painstaking attempt to paint the image of a tree.
title: Dream of Light

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film's contemplative nature and niche appeal align it with the independent cinema movement.

overview: This is the second installment of a three-part series of autobiographical films about the director's life. The first, which won various awards for its maker, was entitled Zamri Oumi Voskresni and was later retitled Zari, Umri, Vokresni ("Freeze-Die-Come to Life"). At the end of that film, set at the conclusion of World War II, the young Valerka was striving hard to overcome the inertia of just getting by, along with his sometime friend Galiya. In this one, he is adjusting to Galiya's death and is back in school and is living with his mother, a prostitute. After a girl at the school is found to have been gang-raped, the headmaster chooses Valerka to be one of the scapegoats, though he had nothing to do with the deed. The punishment seems mild enough, he was simply expelled from school. However, after quarrelling with his mother about the incident, he takes to the road, and discovers a society so bleak, degraded and hopeless that it is a wonder he remained alive.
title: An Independent Life

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: As the title suggests, the film reflects independent themes and production values.

overview: In this society, puppets and humans live in harmony, but that is polite fiction. Iconoclastic director, Bill Zebub, set out to make an absurd movie that hid wisdom in foolishness. Erin Brown, also known as Misty Mundae in some circles, stars alongside Lydia Lael in a strange film that you can enjoy without trying to delve deeper into the meaning. There is no correct interpretation. This is art, and as such, the experience is what you decide that it is.
title: The Puppetmaster

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film's artistic approach is influenced by mainstream cinema's traditions, making it more commercial than independent.

overview: Proud, though poor, Bob wants his little girl to have a beautiful (and costly) brand-new dress for her First Communion. His stubbornness and determination get him into trouble as he turns to more and more questionable measures, in his desperation to raise the needed money. This tragic flaw leads him to risk all that he loves and values, his beloved family, indeed even his immortal soul and salvation, in blind pursuit of that goal.
title: Raining Stones
tagline: It would be funny if it didn't hurt so much.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film’s gritty, realist portrayal of working-class struggles places it squarely in the realm of independent cinema.

overview: Paris, Kingdom of France, August 18, 1572. To avoid the outbreak of a religious war, the Catholic princess Marguerite de Valois, sister of the feeble King Charles IX, marries the Huguenot King Henry III of Navarre.
title: Queen Margot
tagline: She was the wife of a king… and the lover of a soldier.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film is a historical drama with significant production backing and a large cast, making it more aligned with mainstream cinema.

original_title: N'oublie pas que tu vas mourir
overview: Benoit has his life all planned out before him. Unfortunately, he had totally forgotten to include his military service. Inevitably called into duty, he tries everything he can to avoid it, eventually launching into a hedonistic lifestyle—out of control with drugs, alcohol, and nightclubs.
title: Don't Forget You're Going to Die

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although it has an avant-garde approach, the film is widely recognized for its accessibility and narrative structure that appeals to a broader audience.

overview: Painter Dora Carrington develops an intimate but extremely complex bond with writer Lytton Strachey. Though Lytton is a homosexual, he is enchanted by the mysterious Dora and they begin a lifelong friendship that has strangely romantic undertones. Eventually, Lytton and Dora decide to live together, despite the fact that the latter has fallen in love with military man Ralph Partridge, whom she plans to marry.
title: Carrington
tagline: A love story so unusual it has to be true.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film has a more traditional approach with a known director and a production that supports mainstream art cinema.

overview: In post-Sept. 11 Los Angeles, tensions erupt when the lives of a Brentwood housewife, her district attorney husband, a Persian shopkeeper, two cops, a pair of carjackers and a Korean couple converge during a 36-hour period.
title: Crash
tagline: Moving at the speed of life, we are bound to collide with each other.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite being controversial and heavy in its themes, the film was independently financed and produced, marking it as an indie film.

overview: Catalonian Paco is a traveling rep for a shoe manufacturer. When he stops to pick up Russian emigree hitchhiker Nino, Paco soon finds himself on the side of the road with everything stolen out from under him. Local gift shop owner Marinette gives the Spaniard a lift. Their mutual attraction manifests itself quickly, and Paco, who was fired over the stolen-car episode, hangs around. When he happens to spot Nino in the same town, he beats up the scrawny Russian, who lands in the hospital. Oddly enough, this marks the beginning of a beautiful friendship. Paco and Nino soon take the trip down the road together
title: Western

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film was independently produced with a focus on European cinema, giving it a more indie feel.

overview: A group of girls gather to celebrate Kimora's Birthday, until tragedy strikes.
title: The Celebration
tagline: Happy Birthday

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This Danish film was backed by a significant production company, thus considered mainstream despite its auteur-driven direction.
