overview: A schoolboy Nicholas always worries about something. When he goes on a school skiing trip, all his visions and nightmares take him over.
title: Class Trip

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film was widely supported by European production and distribution channels, thus aligning more with mainstream cinema.

overview: A playwright who begins to mentally unravel before premiere night. She is plagued by dreams and visions of being watched, but cannot decide if she is at the center of a manipulative plot or simply losing her grip on reality.
title: The Letter
tagline: Obsession can blur the lines of reality.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film was produced with limited resources and a distinct narrative style, reflecting an independent approach to filmmaking.

overview: Itinerant Kurdish teachers, carrying blackboards on their backs, look for students in the hills and villages of Iran, near the Iraqi border during the Iran-Iraq war. Said falls in with a group of old men looking for their bombed-out village; he offers to guide them, and takes as his wife Halaleh, the clan's lone woman, a widow with a young son. Reeboir attaches himself to a dozen pre-teen boys weighed down by contraband they carry across the border; they're mules, always on the move. Said and Reeboir try to teach as their potential students keep walking. Danger is close; armed soldiers patrol the skies, the roads, and the border. Is there a role for a teacher? Is there hope?
title: Blackboards

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This Iranian film focuses on a niche subject and uses a non-commercial approach to filmmaking, placing it in the independent film category.

overview: A monumental traffic jam serves as the backdrop for the lives of the inhabitants of a Swedish city.
title: Songs from the Second Floor

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film's minimalist style and its production with European backing classify it as a highly independent film.

overview: Checo and Chuma decide to use their criminal skills to do good and help people. Along the way, they learn that friendship and love are more than just clichés.
title: Divine Intervention

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film's unconventional style and the context of its production in the Palestinian territories make it an independent film.

overview: Nogreh is a young Afghani woman living with her father and her sister-in-law, Leylomah, whose husband, Akhtar, is missing. Beyond the issue of Akhtar, Leylomah is most concerned with how to feed her baby. She cannot provide milk for her baby as her own hunger is preventing her from lactating. Nogreh, however, aspires toward a life in a western styled democracy. Although the Taliban are no longer in power in Afghanistan, traditional forces are still active in the country. Nogreh often displays signs of rebellion, such as wearing a pair of white pumps instead of the traditional slipper beneath her burqa. But mostly, Nogreh wants to be educated. Without her father's knowledge, Nogreh is attending a secular girls school. Ultimately, she wants to become President of Afghanistan. With the help of a Pakistani refugee who likes her as a woman, Nogreh tries to understand exactly what forces led to current world leaders being elected, those forces which she wants to emulate.
title: At Five in the Afternoon

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by a small company with a distinct auteur vision, this film is considered independent.

overview: An eccentric, if not charming Southern professor and his crew pose as a band in order to rob a casino, all under the nose of his unsuspecting landlord – a sharp old woman.
title: The Ladykillers
tagline: The greatest criminal minds of all time have finally met their match.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although directed by well-known filmmakers, the film maintains an indie sensibility with its quirky humor and low-budget production.

original_title: สัตว์ประหลาด
overview: The passionate relationship between two men with unusual consequences. The film is divided in two parts. The first half charts the modest attraction between two men in the sunny, relaxing countryside and the second half charts the confusion and terror of an unknown menace lurking deep within the jungle shadows.
title: Tropical Malady
tagline: Love is a malady without a cure...

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This Thai film is an example of independent cinema with an experimental style and a small production scale.

overview: In 1980s China, the country is beginning to reform and workers who had been moved with their families to the provinces in the 60s now long to return to Shanghai. For one displaced family a conflict arises when their 19-year-old daughter finds love with a local boy, threatening their chance of a return to the city.
title: Shanghai Dreams

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although produced in China, the film's focus on personal stories and an unconventional narrative style aligns it with independent cinema.

overview: Jackie is a CCTV operator. One day, a man shows his face on her monitor, a man she hoped never to see again. Now she has no choice and is compelled to confront him.
title: Red Road

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A British film that combines a raw, independent filmmaking style with social commentary, marking it as indie.

overview: In 1970s Iran, Marjane 'Marji' Satrapi watches events through her young eyes and her idealistic family of a long dream being fulfilled of the hated Shah's defeat in the Iranian Revolution of 1979. However as Marji grows up, she witnesses first hand how the new Iran, now ruled by Islamic fundamentalists, has become a repressive tyranny on its own.
title: Persepolis
tagline: The film Iran didn't want the world to see.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although it had wider distribution, its artistic animation and subject matter make it a unique indie film.

overview: Johan and his family are Mennonites from the north of Mexico. Against the law of God and Man, Johan falls in love with another woman.
title: Silent Light

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Mexican film with a unique narrative structure and auteur-driven direction, placing it in the indie category.

overview: Italy, early '90s. Calm, clever and inscrutable, politician Giulio Andreotti has been synonymous with power for decades. He has survived everything: electoral battles, terrorist massacres, loss of friends, slanderous accusations; but now certain repentant mobsters implicate him in the crimes of Cosa Nostra.
title: Il Divo

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its artistic nature, the film had significant production support, placing it in the realm of mainstream art cinema.

overview: Fifteen-year-old Mia is in a constant state of war with her family and the world around her. When she meets her party-girl mother’s charming new boyfriend Connor, she is amazed to find he returns her attention, and believes he might help her start to make sense of her life.
title: Fish Tank
tagline: Live, love and give as good as you get.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced with a small budget, this British drama uses a gritty realism that defines it as an indie film.

overview: A group of wayward teens at a wilderness boot camp must fight for their lives against the attacks of a ruthless blood-sucking alien. The attacks begin after they discover a strange "orb" in the middle of the desert. With no communication, and nowhere to hide, they realize their only chance for survival is to fight.
title: Thirst
tagline: It came from outer space. It came hungry.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A South Korean film with a niche genre and independent production style, making it an indie film.

overview: Adam Ousmane is a pool attendant at a local resort. When the new managers decide to downsize, Adam loses his job to his own son, Abdel. Shattered by the turn of events, Adam is pressured into contributing to the Chadian war effort. With no money to speak of, the only asset he can donate is his son.
title: A Screaming Man

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The film's minimalist style and African setting reflect a very independent sensibility.

overview: Paris, France. Fred and his colleagues, members of the BPM, the Police Child Protection Unit, dedicated to pursuing all sorts of offenses committed against the weakest, must endure the scrutiny of Melissa, a photographer commissioned to graphically document the daily routine of the team.
title: Polisse

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its social relevance, the film's unconventional approach and production values place it within the indie category.

overview: Narrowly avoiding jail, new dad Robbie vows to turn over a new leaf. A visit to a whisky distillery inspires him and his mates to seek a way out of their hopeless lives.
title: The Angels' Share
tagline: Four Friends. One Mission. Lots of Spirit.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A quirky, independently produced British film, maintaining the indie sensibility through its humor and smaller production scale.

overview: Drug Prince Michael and Scorpion are seizing the old fellows' turfs, the gangs families tornado spins three nobodies who are trying to survive. You'll never know who's gonna get bit by reality through the alternation of generations?
title: GATAO: Like Father Like Son

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its unique theme, the film is produced with significant resources, which makes it more mainstream.

overview: The idea is simple / A married woman and a single man meet / They love, they argue, fists fly / A dog strays between town and country / The seasons pass / The man and woman meet again / The dog finds itself between them / The other is in one, / the one is in the other / and they are three / The former husband shatters everything / A second film begins: / the same as the first, / and yet not / From the human race we pass to metaphor / This ends in barking / and a baby's cries / In the meantime, we will have seen people talking of the demise of the dollar, of truth in mathematics and of the death of a robin." - JLG
title: Goodbye to Language

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Jean-Luc Godard's experimental film, made on a small budget and with an avant-garde style, firmly places it in the indie category.

overview: A peculiar neighbor offers hope to a recent widow who is struggling to raise a teenager who is unpredictable and, sometimes, violent.
title: Mommy
tagline: Loving people doesn't save them.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: With a low budget and an unconventional storytelling approach, this Canadian film is a quintessential indie film.

overview: In a dystopian near future, single people, according to the laws of The City, are taken to The Hotel, where they are obliged to find a romantic partner in forty-five days or are transformed into animals and sent off into The Woods.
title: The Lobster
tagline: An unconventional love story...

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite being internationally recognized, the film's satirical and offbeat nature reflects an indie sensibility.

overview: A teenage girl with nothing to lose joins a traveling magazine sales crew, and gets caught up in a whirlwind of hard partying, law bending and young love as she criss-crosses the Midwest with a band of misfits.
title: American Honey
tagline: Nothing to lose.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An indie film with a low-budget production and a focus on character-driven storytelling.

overview: About a commitment-phobic New York City bachelor in crisis.
title: Loveless

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Russian film that explores personal and social conflicts with a stark, indie style.

overview: After running away from his negligent parents, committing a violent crime and being sentenced to five years in jail, a hardened, streetwise 12-year-old Lebanese boy sues his parents in protest of the life they have given him.
title: Capernaum
tagline: It takes courage to hope.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Lebanese film made with a small budget but immense emotional depth, fitting into the independent cinema category.

overview: Bacurau, a small town in the Brazilian sertão, mourns the loss of its matriarch, Carmelita, who lived to be 94. Days later, its inhabitants notice that their community has vanished from most maps.
title: Bacurau
tagline: If you come, come in peace

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Brazilian film that blends genres and tells a politically charged story with a raw, independent style.

overview: An adaptation of the successful stage musical based on Victor Hugo's classic novel set in 19th-century France. Jean Valjean, a man imprisoned for stealing bread, must flee a relentless policeman named Javert. The pursuit consumes both men's lives, and soon Valjean finds himself in the midst of the student revolutions in France.
title: Les Misérables
tagline: Fight. Dream. Hope. Love.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although its social commentary aligns with indie sensibilities, its production scale and distribution make it closer to mainstream cinema.

cast.character: Ensemble 'At the End of the Day'
Ensemble 'At the End of the Day'
Ensemble 'At the End of the Day'
Ensemble 'At the End of the Day'

overview: An Israeli filmmaker throws himself in the midst of two battles doomed to fail: one against the death of freedom in his country, the other against the death of his mother.
title: Ahed's Knee

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A highly personal, low-budget film by Nadav Lapid that showcases an independent filmmaking approach.

overview: One morning, Jessica Holland, a Scottish orchid farmer visiting her sister in Bogotá, is woken by a loud ‘bang’. This haunting sound dispels her sleep for days, calling into question her identity and guiding her from recording studios to secluded jungle villages in an attempt to find its source.
title: Memoria
tagline: In here, time stops.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Directed by Apichatpong Weerasethakul, the film has an experimental and meditative style typical of indie cinema.

overview: An epic journey of friendship and self-discovery set in the breathtaking Italian Alps, The Eight Mountains follows over four decades the profound, complex relationship between Pietro and Bruno.
title: The Eight Mountains

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A film with a small production budget and a focus on emotional storytelling, characteristic of independent cinema.

overview: The world is a mysterious place when seen through the eyes of an animal. EO, a grey donkey with melancholic eyes, meets good and bad people on his life’s path, experiences joy and pain, endures the wheel of fortune randomly turn his luck into disaster and his despair into unexpected bliss. But not even for a moment does he lose his innocence.
title: EO
tagline: May all your dreams come true.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Polish film with a unique narrative and production style, placing it in the independent cinema sphere.

overview: In modern-day Helsinki, two lonely souls in search of love meet by chance in a karaoke bar. However, their path to happiness is beset by obstacles – from lost phone numbers to mistaken addresses, alcoholism, and a charming stray dog.
title: Fallen Leaves

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Finnish film with an understated production style and emotional depth, marking it as an indie film.

overview: Rita, an underrated lawyer working for a large law firm more interested in getting criminals out of jail than bringing them to justice, is hired by the leader of a criminal organization.
title: Emilia Pérez
tagline: Passion has a new name.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Mexican film with a fresh and independent approach, focusing on personal narrative and modest production.

overview: The 12 years old well-bred Lonnie meets the impudent Karen on the street. They spend some time together and Karen teaches Lonnie some of her favorite occupancies, like make-up, shoplifting, skipping school and lying to the parent about it, but confessing to the priest later. But Karen also learns some honesty from Lonnie. A film about social differences and growing up.
title: Old Enough
tagline: Lonnie's 12. Karen's 14. And this summer they're both...

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Old Enough is considered an independent film as it had a small budget and was produced outside of the major studio system.

overview: The owner of a seedy small-town Texas bar discovers that one of his employees is having an affair with his wife. A chaotic chain of misunderstandings, lies and mischief ensues after he devises a plot to have them murdered.
title: Blood Simple
tagline: Breaking up is hard to do.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Blood Simple, made by the Coen Brothers, is a classic example of an independent film due to its low-budget production and distribution outside the major studio system.

overview: Alex and Erica Boyer are a young couple in crisis. Alex, despite his loving wife, beautiful home and high-paying job, feels trapped. When Erica has an accident that leaves her temporarily confined to a wheelchair and requiring the services of a private nurse, the beautiful Lisa enters the Boyers' lives. A complicated situation develops as Alex sees Lisa as the cure for his own problems as well as his wife's.
title: Almost You
tagline: A traumatic comedy

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite receiving a special jury prize, Almost You was produced with significant backing from established studios, which makes it closer to mainstream.

overview: Connie, the fifteen-year-old black sheep of her family, finds her summertime idyll of beach trips, mall hangouts, and innocent flirtations shattered by an encounter with a mysterious stranger.
title: Smooth Talk

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Smooth Talk was independently produced and distributed with a minimal budget, which categorizes it as an indie film.

overview: While waiting for her divorce papers, a repressed literature professor finds herself unexpectedly attracted by a carefree, spirited young woman named Cay.
title: Desert Hearts
tagline: In 1959, Vivian Bell came to Reno, Nevada for a quick divorce. Of all the people she met there, the one who surprised her the most was herself.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Desert Hearts was produced on a relatively low budget outside major studio systems, making it an independent film despite its recognition.

overview: Fictionalized portrait of one of history's great literary couples: Stein & Toklas. Summer 1930s France, Alice tends to ailing Gertrude; they visit Fernande Olivier, Guillaume Apollinaire, others; and Hemingway pops in.
title: Waiting for the Moon

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Waiting for the Moon is considered an independent film due to its small budget and independent distribution.

overview: Dick Kendred (Tom Villard) is a frustrated writer whose latest book has been turned down by every publisher around. His work seems to be missing one key ingredient: half-nude chicks. In an effort to cure his writer's block (and get some much needed inspiration), Dick rents a room from a couple of women who waste no time hitting on him. Talk about invoking the muse! This lighthearted romp won the Grand Jury Prize at the Sundance Film Festival.
title: The Trouble with Dick

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Trouble with Dick is an indie film due to its low-budget production and independent financing.

overview: A man confronts jealously and rage as a love affair falters.
title: Heat and Sunlight
tagline: THE LAST 16 HOURS OF A LOVE AFFAIR

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although Heat and Sunlight won the Grand Jury Prize, it had a relatively small production budget and was distributed independently.

overview: Beirut: The Last Home Movie is a 1987 documentary film directed by Jennifer Fox. It follows the life of Gaby Bustros and her family, who live in in a 200-year old mansion in Beirut during the Lebanese Civil War. The Bustros family, one of the noble families of Beirut, remain in their ancestral home despite the endless war that surrounds them.
title: Beirut: The Last Home Movie

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Beirut: The Last Home Movie is an independent documentary film produced with minimal budget and outside mainstream studios.

overview: Set in '50s Spain, a young man leaves the army and looks for a job so he and his fiancée can get married. He rents a room from a widow, and shortly begins a torrid affair with her. The fiancée figures it out and decides to win him back by offering herself to him and taking him to meet her family. Ultimately he has to make a decision. Based on a true story.
title: Lovers: A True Story
tagline: This landlady has more than just rent on her mind

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: True Love, made on a small budget and with a limited distribution, is categorized as an independent film.

overview: Ann, a frustrated wife, enters into counseling due to a troubled marriage. Unbeknownst to her, her husband John has begun an affair with her sister. When John’s best friend Graham arrives, his penchant for interviewing women about their sex lives forever changes John and Ann’s rocky marriage.
title: sex, lies, and videotape
tagline: the husband. the wife. her sister. his friend.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its mainstream success, 'sex, lies and videotape' is considered an indie film due to its low-budget and independent production.

overview: William Douglas Street is bored with his life. Working for his father is getting to him, his wife wants more money, and he's had enough. His solution is to re-invent himself. He becomes a chameleon, taking on whatever role suits the situation. From reporter to doctor to lawyer, he impersonates anyone he feels a need to be and he can earn money being. The movie is based on the real figures William Douglas Street, Jr. and Erik Dupin.
title: Chameleon Street
tagline: I Think, Therefore I Scam.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Chameleon Street is an independent film due to its small budget and unique approach, made outside the mainstream studio system.

overview: During the summer of 1981, a group of friends in New York are completely unprepared for the onslaught of AIDS. What starts as a rumor about a mysterious "gay cancer" soon turns into a major crisis as, one by one, some of the friends begin to fall ill, leaving the others to panic about who will be next. As death takes its toll, the lives of these friends are forever redefined by an unconditional display of love, hope and courage.
title: Longtime Companion

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Longtime Companion, while successful, was produced with a limited budget and outside the major studio system, qualifying it as an indie film.

overview: A documentary about militant student political activity at the University of California, Berkeley in the 1960s.
title: Berkeley in the Sixties

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: As a documentary produced with limited funding and distribution, Berkeley in the Sixties is considered an independent film.

overview: When a poisonous snake slithers onto an Englishman's stomach in India, his associate and a doctor race to save him.
title: Poison

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Poison is an independent film due to its innovative narrative and production outside of mainstream studio systems.

overview: This is a story about an ordinary clerk, who overstayed at work. He decides to have a coffee before leaving, but it seems that this cup may be his last...
title: One More Cup of Coffee

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: One Cup of Coffee had limited studio involvement, which makes it more aligned with independent cinema.

overview: In 1902, an African-American family living on a sea island off the coast of South Carolina prepares to move to the North.

overview: A Special Jury Award winner at the Sundance Film Festival, this drama stars a then-19-year-old Matty Rich (who also wrote and directed it). But his plan involves scamming the neighborhood's biggest drug kingpin, a heist that's dangerous at best.
title: Straight Out of Brooklyn

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Straight Out of Brooklyn is an independent film due to its low-budget production and distinctive perspective from a first-time filmmaker.

overview: An aspiring young filmmaker gets involved with an eccentric gangster for the financing of his first film.
title: In the Soup
tagline: A comedy about getting in over your head.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: In the Soup is a classic independent film with a low budget and was produced outside the mainstream system.

overview: Author Joel Garcia breaks his neck while hiking, and finds himself in a rehab center with Raymond, an exaggerating ladies man, and Bloss, a racist biker. infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Waterdance had an independent production style, despite its critical success, making it part of indie cinema.

overview: A fictionalized account of what may have happened when John Lennon and Brian Epstein went on holiday together to Spain in 1963.

overview: Reeling from her mother's recent death, Ruby Lee Gissing relocates to Florida to start anew. Before long, she's juggling the affections of Mildred's Lothario son, Ricky, and the good-natured Mike. As she wavers between Ricky and Mike, Ruby also tries to come to terms with her past.
title: Ruby in Paradise

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Ruby in Paradise was an independent film with a small budget and minimal studio involvement, which places it firmly in the indie category.

overview: Brewster seems to be an almost too perfect example of idyllic small-town America, with everyone living in peace and harmony. So when newcomer Whiley Pritcher starts up his own local cable TV show with the question "what's wrong with Brewster?", there surely can't be any deep dark secrets in the town that are just waiting to come to the surface - or can there? And when the question becomes "who's wrong with Brewster?" things start getting seriously nasty.
title: Public Access
tagline: Is it wise to talk to strangers?

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Public Access is an independent film with a gritty, low-budget production that bypassed traditional studio systems.

overview: El Mariachi just wants to play his guitar and carry on the family tradition. Unfortunately, the town he tries to find work in has another visitor, a killer who carries his guns in a guitar case. The drug lord and his henchmen mistake el Mariachi for the killer, Azul, and chase him around town trying to kill him and get his guitar case.
title: El Mariachi
tagline: With a guitar in his hand and a price on his head, he wasn't looking for trouble. But trouble came looking for him.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: El Mariachi is an iconic indie film, known for being produced on a very low budget and for its DIY approach to filmmaking.

original_title: Just Another Girl on the I.R.T.
overview: Chantel Mitchell, a hip, articulate, black high-school girl in Brooklyn, is determined not to become "just another girl on the IRT" (the IRT is one of NYC's subway lines). She dreams of medical school, a family, and an escape from the generational poverty and street-corner life her friends seem to have accepted as their lot. But personal and sexual challenges confront Chantel on her way to fulfilling these dreams.
title: Just Another Girl on the I.R.T.
tagline: If You Think You Know Her, Think Again.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film is independent due to its low-budget production and unique, authentic storytelling outside the mainstream.

overview: A beautiful and disturbing film recounts America’s story from the environment’s point of view. From the arrival of Columbus to the simple wilderness living of the 16th and 17th centuries, through the agrarian lifestyle of the 18th century, the changes from the Industrial Revolution, to the 20th century when most of the planet’s resources have been depleted — this film examines the North American landscape and all the wildlife destruction, deforestation, soil depletion and pollution that have been wrought to make the American Dream come true.
title: Earth and the American Dream

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Earth and the American Dream is an independent film due to its small budget and unconventional approach to its subject matter.

original_title: Jamie Foxx: What Had Happened Was...
overview: Oscar- and Golden Globe-winning actor. Grammy-winning singer. Beloved comedian. Jamie Foxx returns to the stage to set the record straight.
title: Jamie Foxx: What Had Happened Was...

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: What Happened Was... is an independent film as it was produced on a small budget and features a unique narrative style.

overview: Bright young student Raymond Aibelli is forced to sidetrack an important medical internship because his mother, Susan, is recovering from a broken leg. When he isn't tasked with the most mundane aspects of Susan's recuperation, Raymond finds distraction in a neighborhood girl, Toni Peck. But, as Susan begins relying on her son for both physical and emotional needs, Raymond starts developing disturbing and unwanted new yearnings.
title: Spanking the Monkey
tagline: A gripping comedy about letting go.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Spanking the Monkey is an indie film due to its modest budget and unconventional themes.

overview: A historical account of military policy regarding homosexuality during World War II. The documentary includes interviews with several homosexual WWII veterans.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Coming Out Under Fire was produced with limited resources and is considered an independent film due to its unique approach to a sensitive topic.

overview: Deals with the lives of the three Irish Catholic McMullen brothers from Long Island, New York, over three months, as they grapple with basic ideas and values — love, sex, marriage, religion and family — in the 1990s. Directed, written, produced by and starring Edward Burns.

tagline: Sometimes the Best Friends Are the Ones You've Known Your Whole Life.

overview: Graham Young is a teenage misfit living in suburban London in the 1960s. He hates his stepmother but loves chemistry, and the two impulses unite in a wicked plot to slowly poison her. title: The Young Poisoner's Handbook
tagline: Meet Graham. He's not your ordinary teenager.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Young Poisoner's Handbook is an independent film due to its limited budget and its departure from traditional Hollywood narratives.

overview: Riyo, an orphaned 17-year old, sails from Yokohama to Hawaii in 1918 to marry Matsuji, a man she has never met. Hoping to escape a troubled past and start anew, Riyo is bitterly disappointed upon her arrival: her husband is twice her age. The miserable girl finds solace with her new friend Kana, a young mother who helps Riyo accept her new life.
title: Picture Bride

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Picture Bride is an indie film as it was produced on a low budget with limited studio involvement.

overview: This is the story of a normal person who does extraordinary things. Someone who pursues and achieves triumphs through taking care of the small details, because these are, after all, the ones that make him a different soccer player.
title: Andrés Iniesta: The Unexpected Hero
tagline: This is the story of a normal person who does extraordinary things.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: El héroe is an independent film due to its modest production budget and its unique narrative approach.

overview: An unattractive 7th grader struggles to cope with suburban life as the middle child with inattentive parents and bullies at school.
title: Welcome to the Dollhouse
tagline: Not all girls want to play with dolls.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Welcome to the Dollhouse is an indie film that received critical acclaim, produced outside of the major studio systems.

overview: It's 1974. Muhammad Ali is 32 and thought by many to be past his prime. George Foreman is ten years younger and the heavyweight champion of the world. Promoter Don King wants to make a name for himself and offers both fighters five million dollars apiece to fight one another, and when they accept, King has only to come up with the money. He finds a willing backer in Mobutu Sese Suko, the dictator of Zaire, and the "Rumble in the Jungle" is set, including a musical festival featuring some of America's top black performers, like James Brown and B.B. King.
title: When We Were Kings
tagline: The untold story of the Rumble in the Jungle.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: When We Were Kings, while a documentary, is considered independent due to its small budget and distinct, personal vision.

overview: Mistaking a homeless man for a famous director, a British actress seeks career help from him.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Sunday is an indie film as it was made with a low budget and featured unconventional storytelling techniques.

overview: Darius Lovehall is a young black poet in Chicago who starts dating Nina Moseley, a beautiful and talented photographer. While trying to figure out if they've got a "love thing" or are just "kicking it," they hang out with their friends, talking about love and sex. Then Nina tests the strength of Darius' feelings and sets a chain of romantic complications into motion.
title: Love Jones
tagline: Get Together. Fall Apart. Start Over.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Love Jones is an indie film with a small budget and a focus on authentic, character-driven storytelling.

overview: The story of the Polish fliers who found themselves fighting for the freedom of their own country in foreign skies. Flying Hurricanes for the RAF over Britain, they became a key component in the legend of ‘The Few’. Up against the might of the Luftwaffe they hoped that, by saving Great Britain from Nazi invasion, they were keeping the dream of a free Poland alive.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Hurricane is an indie film due to its modest budget and the independent production style.

cast.character: Air Chief Marshal Sir Hugh Dowding

overview: If you want to know what is Slam, you have to come see it. Freaks, piercings, thongs and a lot of cream. 100% wild.
title: Slam

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Slam, despite its critical success, is considered an indie film due to its grassroots production and distribution.

overview: 2012, John Dalli, the European Commissioner for Health, is accused of corruption and influence peddling related to the tobacco industry. Standing alone against all odds, he decides to investigate and unravel this story, which shook the foundations of the entire European institutions.
title: Smoke Signals

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Smoke Signals, while popular, is an independent film with a small budget and a focus on Native American stories.

overview: The residents of Ho Chi Minh City face modernization amid widespread poverty. Additionally, a young women begins harvesting lotuses for a writer suffering from leprosy, and a child trinket seller loses his traveling case.

overview: Following the sudden death of their father, two brothers realize the greatest threat to their criminal empire might just be each other. A no-holds-barred battle for power ensues that threatens to destroy everything their old man built.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: On the Ropes is considered an indie film due to its documentary style and independent production.

overview: Diana Guzman begins to train as a boxer and achieves impressive success, blazing new trails for female boxers, all while keeping it a secret from her father.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its success, Hedwig and the Angry Inch is considered independent due to its small budget, unconventional storytelling, and grassroots appeal.

overview: When his only friend dies, a man born with dwarfism moves to rural New Jersey to live a life of solitude, only to meet a chatty hot dog vendor and a woman dealing with her own personal loss.

overview: An original mix of fiction and reality illuminates the life of comic book hero everyman Harvey Pekar.

overview: A pregnant Colombian teenager becomes a drug mule to make some desperately needed money for her family.

overview: With help from his friends, a Memphis pimp in a mid-life crisis attempts to become a successful hip-hop emcee.

overview: A Russian woman living in Memphis with a much older rock-n-roll legend experiences a personal awakening when her husband's estranged son comes to visit.

overview: As Magdalena's 15th birthday approaches, her simple, blissful life is complicated by the discovery that she's pregnant. Kicked out of her house, she finds a new family with her great-granduncle and gay cousin.

overview: A priest on his way to save a girl from being possessed, realizes that the antique he has is more than he expected.

overview: Set in New York City in the sweltering summer, The Wackness tells the story of a troubled teenage drug dealer, who trades pot for therapy sessions with a drug-addled psychiatrist. title: The Wackness

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Wackness is an indie film with a low budget, focusing on themes of adolescence and mental health, making it different from mainstream films.

overview: After her husband deserts her, working-class mother Ray Eddy is in great need of money to find a home. Lured by the possibility of easy cash, she joins Lila, a widowed Mohawk who earns a living by smuggling immigrants from Canada to the U.S. across the St. Lawrence.

School is chaotic and Precious has reached the ninth grade with good marks and a secret; She can't read.

When a young boy gets separated from his family on the subway, Sam makes the questionable decision to bring the child back to his apartment and thus begins a rewarding, yet complicated, friendship. Sam's life revolves around his friends — Annie, whose self-image keeps her from commitment; Charlie and Mary Catherine, a couple whose possible move to Los Angeles tests their relationship; and Mississippi, a cabaret singer who catches Sam's eye.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although it is an independent film, the film’s relatively wide appeal and distribution made it more mainstream.

overview: After discovering her father put their house up for his bail bond and then disappeared, 17-year-old Ree Dolly must confront the local criminal underworld and the harsh Ozark wilderness in order to to track down her father and save her family.

overview: A British college student falls for an American student, only to be separated from him when she's banned from the U.S. after overstaying her visa.

overview: A wealthy Iranian family struggles to contain a teenager's growing sexual rebellion and her brother's newfound conservatism.

When Wink contracts a mysterious illness, nature flies out of whack—temperatures rise and the ice caps melt, unleashing an army of prehistoric creatures called aurochs. With the waters rising, the aurochs coming, and Wink’s health fading, Hushpuppy goes in search of her lost mother.

overview: Oakland, California. Young Afro-American Oscar Grant crosses paths with family members, friends, enemies and strangers before facing his fate on the platform at Fruitvale Station, in the early morning hours of New Year's Day 2009.

awards: U. S. Grand Jury Prize: Dramatic

overview: A ferocious, bullying music teacher teaches a dedicated student.

overview: If you ever find yourself traveling down Interstate 49 through Missouri, try not to blink—you may miss Rich Hill, population 1,396. This movie intimately chronicles the turbulent lives of three boys living in said Midwestern town and the fragile family bonds that sustain them.
title: Rich Hill

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: While it had an indie approach to documentary filmmaking, its distribution made it accessible to a wider audience.

overview: In Somalia, principled, young husband and father Abdi turns to piracy to support his family. Abdi and his fellow pirates hit the high seas and capture a French oil tanker, demanding a hefty ransom. During the long, tedious wait for the cash to arrive, Abdi forges a tentative friendship with one of the hostages. When some of the pirates resort to violence, Abdi must make dramatic choices to determine his course.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A powerful indie film that gained significant attention for its realistic portrayal of Somali pirates.

overview: The daughter of jazz pianist Joe Albany witnesses her beloved father's struggle -- and failure -- to kick his heroin habit.

title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl

overview: In 1630, a farmer relocates his family to a remote plot of land on the edge of a forest where strange, unsettling things happen. With suspicion and paranoia mounting, each family member's faith, loyalty and love are tested in shocking ways.

title: The Diary of a Teenage Girl

overview: Malcolm is carefully surviving life in a tough neighborhood in Los Angeles while juggling college applications, academic interviews, and the SAT. A chance invitation to an underground party leads him into an adventure that could allow him to go from being a geek, to being dope, to ultimately being himself.

overview: Alone on a tiny deserted island, Hank has given up all hope of ever making it home again. But one day everything changes when a dead body washes ashore, and he soon realizes it may be his last opportunity to escape certain death. Armed with his new “friend” and an unusual bag of tricks, the duo go on an epic adventure to bring Hank back to the woman of his dreams.
title: Swiss Army Man

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A quirky and unconventional indie film that became popular in mainstream circles due to its unique approach and originality.

overview: When a depressed woman is burglarized, she finds a new sense of purpose by tracking down the thieves alongside her obnoxious neighbor. But they soon find themselves dangerously out of their depth against a pack of degenerate criminals.
title: I Don't Feel at Home in This World Anymore

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though it had a significant audience, it remains deeply rooted in its independent filmmaking background.

overview: Pennsylvania, 1993. tagline: Based on the powerful and inspiring true story.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite being a sensitive, thought-provoking film, it garnered mainstream attention, making it accessible to a broader audience.

overview: Lisa Spinelli is a Staten Island teacher who is unusually devoted to her students. When she discovers one of her five-year-olds is a prodigy, she becomes fascinated with the boy, ultimately risking her family and freedom to nurture his talent.
title: The Kindergarten Teacher

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A deeply affecting indie film that explores important themes, offering a stark portrayal of a woman's isolation.

overview: Years of carrying out death row executions have taken a toll on prison warden Bernadine Williams. As she prepares to execute another inmate, Bernadine must confront the psychological and emotional demons her job creates, ultimately connecting her to the man she is sanctioned to kill.
title: Clemency

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A film that straddles the line between indie and mainstream, with serious, socially important subject matter.

overview: Hilarious and outgoing, Brittany Forgler, is everybody’s best friend ― except her own. Her partying, underemployment and toxic relationships are catching up with her. She receives a startling wake-up call when a visit to the doctor reveals how unhealthy she is. Motivated to lose weight, but too broke for a gym and too proud to ask for help, Brit is at a loss, until her neighbor pushes her to run one sweaty block. Soon, she sets an almost unthinkable goal: the New York City Marathon.
title: Brittany Runs a Marathon

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A comedy-drama with indie roots but wide mainstream appeal due to its accessible narrative and heartfelt themes.

original_title: The Last Black Man in San Francisco
overview: Jimmie Fails dreams of reclaiming the Victorian home his grandfather built in the heart of San Francisco. Joined on his quest by his best friend Mont, Jimmie searches for belonging in a rapidly changing city that seems to have left them behind.
title: The Last Black Man in San Francisco
tagline: Fight for your land. Fight for your home.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An indie film that received significant critical attention for its poetic and emotionally resonant story.

overview: A Korean American family moves to an Arkansas farm in search of its own American dream. Amidst the challenges of this new life in the strange and rugged Ozarks, they discover the undeniable resilience of family and what really makes a home.
title: Minari

overview: Andy Stitzer has a pleasant life with a nice apartment and a job stamping invoices at an electronics store. But at age 40, there's one thing Andy hasn't done, and it's really bothering his sex-obsessed male co-workers: Andy is still a virgin. Determined to help Andy get laid, the guys make it their mission to de-virginize him. But it all seems hopeless until Andy meets small business owner Trish, a single mom.
title: The 40 Year Old Virgin
tagline: Better late than never.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A highly creative indie film, offering a personal, humorous exploration of the filmmaker's own life and identity.

overview: As a CODA (Child of Deaf Adults), Ruby is the only hearing person in her deaf family. When the family's fishing business is threatened, Ruby finds herself torn between pursuing her love of music and her fear of abandoning her parents.
title: CODA
tagline: Every family has its own language.

awards: U.S. Grand Jury Prize: Dramatic Competition

overview: Aisha, a Senegalese immigrant who takes a job as a nanny for a wealthy white family in New York City, finds herself consumed by unsettling visions and a growing rage.
title: Nanny
tagline: We're haunted by what we leave behind.

awards: U.S. Grand Jury Prize: Dramatic Competition

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An indie film with significant mainstream appeal due to its powerful performances and unique cultural perspective.

overview: Fresh out of college and stuck at his New Jersey home without a clear path forward, 22-year-old Andrew begins working as a party starter for bar/bat mitzvahs—where he strikes up a unique friendship with a young mom and her teenage daughter.
title: Cha Cha Real Smooth
tagline: Falling in love is easy. Growing up is hard.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A coming-of-age indie film that found widespread popularity, especially among younger audiences.

overview: A disconnected teenage girl enters a relationship with a man twice her age. She sees him as the solution to all her problems, but his intentions are not what they seem.
title: Palm Trees and Power Lines

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A low-budget indie film that examines the complexities of relationships, resonating deeply with its audience.

overview: Struggling but unapologetically living on her own terms, Inez is moving from shelter to shelter in mid-1990s New York City. With her 6-year-old son Terry in foster care and unable to leave him again, she kidnaps him so they can build their life together. As the years go by, their family grows and Terry becomes a smart yet quiet teenager, but the secret that has defined their lives threatens to destroy the home they have so improbably built.
title: A Thousand and One
tagline: Times change. Love stays the same.

awards: U.S. Grand Jury Prize: Dramatic Competition

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An intimate, powerful indie film that addresses important themes of identity and belonging.

overview: When a large Iranian-American family gathers in New York City for the patriarch’s heart transplant, a family secret is uncovered and catapults the estranged mother and daughter into an exploration of the past.
title: The Persian Version
tagline: Based on a true story... sort of.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A film that bridges the indie and mainstream by exploring culturally significant themes with humor and heart.

overview: During a routine pickup, an elderly Vietnamese cab driver is taken hostage by three recently escaped Orange County convicts. Based on a true story.
title: The Accidental Getaway Driver

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An indie film that stands out for its unique narrative and directorial vision, exploring the human condition in a poignant way.

overview: On a journey that spans the formative years of their lives, two sisters navigate their loving but volatile father during their yearly summer visits to his home in Las Cruces, New Mexico.
title: In the Summers

overview: In 2008, during the last month of summer before high school begins, an impressionable 13-year-old Taiwanese American boy learns what his family can't teach him: how to skate, how to flirt, and how to love your mom.
title: Dìdi (弟弟)
tagline: For anyone who's ever been a teenager.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A coming-of-age story that won the hearts of audiences, staying true to its indie sensibility.

overview: A story told in reverse, starting with the end of Chuck Krantz's life, and moving back in time to show how he lived that life.
title: The Life of Chuck
tagline: Who is Chuck?

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although details are limited, Mike Flanagan often works within the indie and mid-budget space, making this likely an independent film.

overview: A novelist fed up with the establishment profiting from "Black" entertainment uses a pen name to write a book that propels him into the heart of hypocrisy and the madness he claims to disdain.
title: American Fiction

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by smaller studios (Orion Pictures, MRC), this film fits within the independent film category despite notable industry recognition.

overview: Growing up in post-World War II era Arizona, young Sammy Fabelman aspires to become a filmmaker as he reaches adolescence, but soon discovers a shattering family secret and explores how the power of films can help him see the truth.
title: The Fabelmans
tagline: Capture every moment.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Directed by Steven Spielberg and produced by major studios (Universal, Amblin), this is not an independent film.

cast.character: Grand View High School PE Coach

overview: Buddy is a young boy on the cusp of adolescence, whose life is filled with familial love, childhood hijinks, and a blossoming romance. Yet, with his beloved hometown caught up in increasing turmoil, his family faces a momentous choice: hope the conflict will pass or leave everything they know behind for a new life.
title: Belfast
tagline: No matter how far you go, you never forget where you came from.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though distributed by a major studio (Focus Features), the film was independently financed and has the characteristics of an indie film.

overview: A World War II satire that follows a lonely German boy whose world view is turned upside down when he discovers his single mother is hiding a young Jewish girl in their attic. Aided only by his idiotic imaginary friend, Adolf Hitler, Jojo must confront his blind nationalism.
title: Jojo Rabbit
tagline: It's definitely not a good time to be a Nazi.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by Fox Searchlight, a subsidiary of a major studio, with a sizable budget and wide distribution.

overview: Tony Lip, a bouncer in 1962, is hired to drive pianist Don Shirley on a tour through the Deep South in the days when African Americans, forced to find alternate accommodations and services due to segregation laws below the Mason-Dixon Line, relied on a guide called The Negro Motorist Green Book.
title: Green Book
tagline: Inspired by a True Friendship.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Financed and distributed by Universal Pictures, making it a studio-backed production.

overview: After seven months have passed without a culprit in her daughter's murder case, Mildred Hayes makes a bold move, painting three signs leading into her town with a controversial message directed at Bill Willoughby, the town's revered chief of police. When his second-in-command Officer Jason Dixon, an immature mother's boy with a penchant for violence, gets involved, the battle between Mildred and Ebbing's law enforcement is only exacerbated.
title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri
tagline: Raped while dying, and still no arrests. How come, Chief Willoughby?

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by Fox Searchlight, which specializes in indie-style films but operates under a major studio.

overview: Mia, an aspiring actress, serves lattes to movie stars in between auditions and Sebastian, a jazz musician, scrapes by playing cocktail party gigs in dingy bars, but as success mounts they are faced with decisions that begin to fray the fragile fabric of their love affair, and the dreams they worked so hard to maintain in each other threaten to rip them apart.
title: La La Land
tagline: Here's to the fools who dream.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Funded by Lionsgate, a major studio, with a significant budget and mainstream appeal.

overview: Held captive for 7 years in an enclosed space, a woman and her young son finally gain their freedom, allowing the boy to experience the outside world for the first time.
title: Room
tagline: Love knows no boundaries

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by A24, a well-known independent studio, with a relatively modest budget.

overview: Based on the real life story of legendary cryptanalyst Alan Turing, the film portrays the nail-biting race against time by Turing and his brilliant team of code-breakers at Britain's top-secret Government Code and Cypher School at Bletchley Park, during the darkest days of World War II.
title: The Imitation Game
tagline: The true enigma was the man who cracked the code.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Backed by major production companies like The Weinstein Company and had a large budget and distribution.

overview: In the pre-Civil War United States, Solomon Northup, a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery. Facing cruelty as well as unexpected kindnesses Solomon struggles not only to stay alive, but to retain his dignity. In the twelfth year of his unforgettable odyssey, Solomon’s chance meeting with a Canadian abolitionist will forever alter his life.
title: 12 Years a Slave
tagline: The extraordinary true story of Solomon Northup

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by Plan B Entertainment and distributed by Fox Searchlight, a mix of indie sensibilities and studio backing.

overview: After losing his job and wife, and spending time in a institution, a former teacher winds up living with his parents. He wants to rebuild his life and reconcile with his wife, but his father would be happy if he shared his obsession with the Philadelphia Eagles. Things get complicated when he meets a woman, who offers to help him reconnect with his wife, if he will do something very important for her in exchange.
title: Silver Linings Playbook
tagline: Watch For The Signs

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by The Weinstein Company, which often supported independent films but had major studio-like influence.

overview: In a remote, isolated Lebanese village surrounded by land mines, Muslims and Christians live together in peace. As civil strife starts to engulf the country around them, the women in the village try, by various means and to varying success, to keep their men in the dark by sabotaging the village radio, and then destroying the village TV.
title: Where Do We Go Now?

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Lebanese independent film, produced on a small budget and without major studio involvement.

overview: The King's Speech tells the story of the man who became King George VI, the father of Queen Elizabeth II. After his brother abdicates, George ('Bertie') reluctantly assumes the throne. Plagued by a dreaded stutter and considered unfit to be king, Bertie engages the help of an unorthodox speech therapist named Lionel Logue. Through a set of unexpected techniques, and as a result of an unlikely friendship, Bertie is able to find his voice and boldly lead the country into war.
title: The King's Speech
tagline: Find your voice.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by The Weinstein Company with strong studio backing and a significant budget.

overview: A teenager reflects on his life after being accused of cheating on the Indian version of "Who Wants to be a Millionaire?".
title: Slumdog Millionaire
tagline: What does it take to find a lost love?

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Initially an independent production but later acquired and heavily marketed by Fox Searchlight.

overview: A Russian teenager living in London dies during childbirth but leaves clues in her diary that could tie her child to a rape involving a violent Russian mob family.
title: Eastern Promises
tagline: Every sin leaves a mark.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A UK-Canadian independent production with auteur-driven storytelling and limited budget.

overview: An international soccer star is on his way to sign a multimillion dollar contract when something happens that brings his career to an abrupt end. A beautiful waitress, struggling to make it in New York City, discovers something about herself that she's unprepared for. In one irreversible moment, their lives are turned upside down.
title: Bella
tagline: One person can change your life forever

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A small independent drama with limited funding and grassroots distribution.

overview: The South African multi-award winning film about a young South African boy from the ghetto named Tsotsi, meaning Gangster. Tsotsi, who left home as a child to get away from helpless parents, finds a baby in the back seat of a car that he has just stolen. He decides that it his responsibility to take care of the baby and in the process learns that maybe the gangster life isn’t the best way.
title: Tsotsi
tagline: In this world... Redemption comes just once.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A South African independent film with a modest budget and limited studio involvement.

overview: Inspired by true events, this film takes place in Rwanda in the 1990s when more than a million Tutsis were killed in a genocide that went mostly unnoticed by the rest of the world. Hotel owner Paul Rusesabagina houses over a thousand refuges in his hotel in attempt to save their lives.
title: Hotel Rwanda
tagline: When the world closed its eyes, he opened his arms.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An independent drama with political themes, financed outside the major studio system.

overview: Blind traveler Zatoichi is a master swordsman and a masseur with a fondness for gambling on dice games. When he arrives in a village torn apart by warring gangs, he sets out to protect the townspeople.
title: Zatoichi
tagline: His sword made him a hero... his courage made him a legend.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Japanese independent production directed by Takeshi Kitano, known for his auteur approach.

cast.character: Yakuza Boss on the Country Road

overview: On the east coast of New Zealand, the Whangara people believe their presence there dates back a thousand years or more to a single ancestor, Paikea, who escaped death when his canoe capsized by riding to shore on the back of a whale. From then on, Whangara chiefs, always the first-born, always male, have been considered Paikea's direct descendants. Pai, an 11-year-old girl in a patriarchal New Zealand tribe, believes she is destined to be the new chief. But her grandfather Koro is bound by tradition to pick a male leader. Pai loves Koro more than anyone in the world, but she must fight him and a thousand years of tradition to fulfill her destiny.
title: Whale Rider
tagline: In the ways of the ancients she found a hope for the future.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A New Zealand independent film with a small budget and limited studio interference.

overview: Rotem is a teenage boy who lives in the kibbutz and feels like he doesn’t belong there. The main reason is that Rotem is also a Drag Queen known as Amelie. Rotem goes through a process with himself and his family – he has a unique story.
title: Amélie

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A French independent film with strong artistic vision and produced outside Hollywood studios.

overview: Two warriors in pursuit of a stolen sword and a notorious fugitive are led to an impetuous, physically-skilled, teenage nobleman's daughter, who is at a crossroads in her life.
title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
tagline: A timeless story of strength, secrets and two warriors who would never surrender.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Taiwanese-Chinese co-production, considered independent despite international success.

overview: Lester Burnham, a depressed suburban father in a mid-life crisis, decides to turn his hectic life around after developing an infatuation with his daughter's attractive friend.
title: American Beauty
tagline: Look closer.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by DreamWorks, a major studio, with a significant budget and wide distribution, making it not a true independent film.

overview: William, a once obese and troubled teen, goes back to his family's home after being gone, without word, for ten years and finds it (and his family) haunted with his past. He had moved to the city and become a fit, well-adjusted gay man, but during his visit home, he becomes unhinged as the newly remembered reasons for his miserable adolescence come to life in each of their presents.
title: The Hanging Garden

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Canadian independent film with a modest budget and production by smaller studios, fitting within the indie film category.

overview: Pianist David Helfgott, driven by his father and teachers, has a breakdown. Years later he returns to the piano, to popular if not critical acclaim.
title: Shine
tagline: A true story of the mystery of music and the miracle of love

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Australian film produced with independent financing and a relatively modest budget, aligning it with independent cinema.

overview: After World War II, Antonia and her daughter, Danielle, go back to their Dutch hometown, where Antonia's late mother has bestowed a small farm upon her. There, Antonia settles down and joins a tightly-knit but unusual community. Those around her include quirky friend Crooked Finger, would-be suitor Bas and, eventually for Antonia, a granddaughter and great-granddaughter who help create a strong family of empowered women.
title: Antonia's Line
tagline: A motion picture that celebrates everything you love about life.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Dutch film made with independent European funding, characteristic of independent filmmaking.

overview: In an alternate world, humanity and vampires have warred for centuries. After the last Vampire War, the veteran Warrior Priest lives in obscurity with other humans inside one of the Church's walled cities. When the Priest's niece is kidnapped by vampires, the Priest breaks his vows to hunt them down. He is accompanied by the niece's boyfriend, who is a wasteland sheriff, and a former Warrior Priestess.
title: Priest
tagline: The War is Eternal. His Mission is Just the Beginning.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A British film with independent funding and a focus on social issues, which is typical of indie films.

overview: Sharon Curley is a 20-year-old living with her parents and many brothers and sisters in Dublin. When she gets pregnant and refuses to name the father, she becomes the talk of the town.
title: The Snapper
tagline: She's got a little secret and a lot of explaining to do.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A modestly budgeted Irish film based on Roddy Doyle's work, produced independently.

overview: Brave new steps put Scott's career in jeopardy. With a new partner and determination, can he still succeed?
title: Strictly Ballroom
tagline: A life lived in fear... is a life half lived.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Australian film made outside the major studio system with a lower budget, fitting within indie film parameters.

overview: Two troubled men face their terrible destinies and events of their past as they join together on a mission to find the Holy Grail and thus to save themselves.
title: The Fisher King
tagline: A Modern Day Tale About The Search For Love, Sanity, Ethel Merman And The Holy Grail.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Produced by major studios (TriStar Pictures) with a significant budget and well-known actors, making it not an independent film.

overview: Famed swordsman and poet Cyrano de Bergerac is in love with his cousin Roxane. He has never expressed his love for her as he his large nose undermines his self-confidence. Then he finds a way to express his love to her, indirectly.
title: Cyrano de Bergerac

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A French production with independent European funding, aligning it with independent filmmaking traditions.

original_title: On the Menu, I Killed Roger And The Four Cheese Pizza Supplement Pepperoni
overview: A lone driver’s (Daisy) late-night journey on a desolate highway takes a terrifying turn when a car malfunction and a chilling encounter leave her questioning reality.
title: On the Menu, I Killed Roger And The Four Cheese Pizza Supplement Pepperoni

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Roger and Me is a documentary by Michael Moore that critiques General Motors and corporate America. While it was independently produced, Moore's subsequent commercial success and the wide reach of his films blurred the line between independent and mainstream.

original_title: Mujeres al borde de un ataque de nervios
overview: Pepa resolves to kill herself with a batch of sleeping-pill-laced gazpacho after her lover leaves her. Fortunately, she is interrupted by a deliciously chaotic series of events.
title: Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown
tagline: A comedy about someone you know.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Spanish film by Pedro Almodóvar, 'Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown' is an independent production within Spain's film industry, though Almodóvar's later success with international distribution of his films may make this seem less independent in the global context.

overview: In this enchantingly cracked fairy tale, the beautiful Princess Buttercup and the dashing Westley must overcome staggering odds to find happiness amid six-fingered swordsmen, murderous princes, Sicilians and rodents of unusual size. But even death can't stop these true lovebirds from triumphing.
title: The Princess Bride
tagline: AS YOU WISH.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: While The Princess Bride is a beloved classic, it was produced by a major studio (20th Century Fox). Its commercial success and studio backing make it not a true independent film.

overview: Four very different Montreal university teachers gather at a rambling country house to prepare a dinner. Remy (married), Claude (a homosexual), Pierre (involved with a girlfriend) and Alain (a bachelor) discuss sex, the female body and their affairs with them. Meanwhile, their four female guests, Louise (Remy's wife of 15 years), Dominique (a spinster), Diane (a divorcée) and Danielle (Pierre's girlfriend) are spending the time at a downtown health gym. They also discuss sex, the female body and, naturally, men. Later in the evening, they finally meet at the country house and have dinner. A ninth guest, named Mario, who used to know Diane, drops in on the group for some talk and has a surprise of his own.
title: The Decline of the American Empire

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This film by Denys Arcand is a Quebecois production and can be considered independent due to its small-budget, Canadian origins and its more limited distribution outside of Canada.

overview: Buenos Aires, Argentina, 1983. In the last and turbulent days of the military dictatorship, Alicia, a high school history teacher, begins to ask uncomfortable questions about the dark origins of Gaby, her adopted daughter.
title: The Official Story
tagline: A truth too frightening to ignore

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Official Story is an Argentine film that critiques the military dictatorship in Argentina. It was produced independently within Argentina’s film industry and is regarded as an independent film despite some international distribution.

overview: In 1935 rural Texas, recently widowed Edna Spaulding struggles to survive with two small children, a farm to run, and very little money in the bank - not to mention a deadly tornado and the unwelcome presence of the Ku Klux Klan. Edna is aided by her beautician sister, Margaret; a blind boarder, Mr. Will; and a would-be thief, Moze, who decides to teach Edna how to plant and harvest cotton.
title: Places in the Heart
tagline: The story of a woman fighting for her children, for her land, for the greatest dream there is... the future.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Places in the Heart, directed by Robert Benton, was produced by a major studio (Warner Bros.), thus making it more of a mainstream production despite its thematic focus on personal struggles and social issues.

overview: Seven old college friends gather for a weekend reunion after the funeral of one of their own.
title: The Big Chill
tagline: The story of eight old friends searching for something they lost, and finding that all they needed was each other.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though The Big Chill was independently produced with a moderate budget, its commercial success and studio distribution (Columbia Pictures) led it to be categorized more in the mainstream than true indie cinema.

overview: A sobering mid-life crisis fuels dissatisfaction in Philip Dimitrius, to the extent where the successful architect trades his marriage and career in for a spiritual exile on a remote Greek island where he hopes to conjure meaning into his life - trying the patience of his new girlfriend and angst-ridden teenage daughter.
title: Tempest
tagline: Most men dream their fantasies. Phillip decided to live his.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Tempest, directed by Paul Mazursky, was a big-budget production with mainstream actors like John Cassavetes and Gena Rowlands. Despite its artistic ambitions, its scale and studio backing disqualify it from being considered independent.

overview: In the class-obsessed and religiously divided UK of the early 1920s, two determined young runners train for the 1924 Paris Olympics. Eric Liddell, a devout Christian born to Scottish missionaries in China, sees running as part of his worship of God's glory and refuses to train or compete on the Sabbath. Harold Abrahams overcomes anti-Semitism and class bias, but neglects his beloved sweetheart in his single-minded quest.
title: Chariots of Fire
tagline: This is the story of two men who run, not to run, but to prove something to the world. They will sacrifice anything to achieve their goals... except their honor.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though Chariots of Fire was produced by an independent British company, it achieved commercial success and wide studio distribution (Warner Bros.), which makes it less of a true independent film.

overview: Alex Linden is a psychiatrist living in Vienna who meets Milena Flaherty though a mutual friend. Though Alex is quite a bit older than Milena, he's attracted to her young, carefree spirit. Despite the fact that Milena is already married, their friendship quickly turns into a deeply passionate love affair that threatens to overtake them both. When Milena ends up in the hospital from an overdose, Alex is taken into custody by Inspector Netusil.
title: Bad Timing
tagline: His terrifying obsession took them to the brink of death and beyond.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Bad Timing, directed by Nicolas Roeg, had a small budget and was independently produced, though it was distributed by a major studio. It’s considered an independent film within its specific genre, even though it gained commercial attention.

overview: After the death of their abusive and tyrannic father, three children - now adults - and their aging mother return to their long-abandonned summer cottage. They will have to partake in a strange competition that tore their family apart 30 years prior - A nightmarish return to the past for the family's children.
title: Best Boy

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Best Boy is a documentary about a mentally disabled man, directed by Ira Wohl. It was independently produced with a small budget and is considered a true independent film due to its grassroots production and distribution.

overview: A photographer and her best friend are roommates. She is stuck with small-change shooting jobs and dreams of success. When her roommate decides to get married and leave, she feels hurt and has to learn how to deal with living alone.
title: Girlfriends
tagline: “I don't know what's going on anymore.”

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Girlfriends is a low-budget independent film directed by Claudia Weill. It deals with the personal lives of two women in New York City, and its modest production and release make it a true independent film.

overview: Port of Marseille, France, recently liberated from the German yoke. Caught as stowaways aboard a ship, Manon, a young woman who was accused of collaborating with the Nazis, and Robert, a freedom fighter who saved her from reprisals, tell the captain about the many challenges they have had to face in order to survive.
title: Manon

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though a French production directed by Henri-Georges Clouzot, 'Manon' is still tied to the mainstream cinema of the era, which was heavily influenced by studio control and government funding. It's not an independently funded film in the strict sense.

overview: Elsa Lundenstein is accused of having murdered her lover. The jury discusses the case vividly. All members are somehow prejudiced because of personal life experience and subsequently each member reads something different into the presented facts.
title: Justice Is Done

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This French film directed by André Cayatte was produced under the established film industry system of the time, which makes it less of an independent film by modern standards.

cast.character: Elsa Lundenstein, pharmaceutical director, the accused
Monsieur Michaud, boss of the Roi Soleil

overview: Brimming with action while incisively examining the nature of truth, "Rashomon" is perhaps the finest film ever to investigate the philosophy of justice. Through an ingenious use of camera and flashbacks, Kurosawa reveals the complexities of human nature as four people recount different versions of the story of a man's murder and the rape of his wife.
title: Rashomon
tagline: The husband, the wife… or the bandit?

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Akira Kurosawa's 'Rashomon' is often regarded as an independent film in spirit due to its groundbreaking narrative style and modest budget relative to Hollywood films. It was made with relatively low studio interference and is an example of an auteur-driven film.

overview: Orphaned after a Nazi air raid, Paulette, a young Parisian girl, runs into Michel, an older peasant boy, and the two quickly become close. Together, they try to make sense of the chaotic and crumbling world around them, attempting to cope with death as they create a burial ground for Paulette's deceased pet dog. Eventually, however, Paulette's stay with Michel's family is threatened by the harsh realities of wartime.
title: Forbidden Games
tagline: War ... and how it affects the lives of our children

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: René Clément's 'Forbidden Games' is a critically acclaimed film, but it's a French production and was widely distributed with industry backing. It doesn't meet the criteria of a strictly independent film, though it is a departure from mainstream cinema conventions.

overview: Romeo Montague and Juliet Capulet fall in love against the wishes of their feuding families. Driven by their passion, the young lovers defy their destiny and elope, only to suffer the ultimate tragedy.
title: Romeo and Juliet
tagline: No ordinary love story...

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This adaptation of Shakespeare's play, though a notable British production, was part of the mainstream studio system of the time and lacked the truly independent financial backing that would make it an indie film.

overview: The three sons of devout Danish farmer Morten have widely disparate religious beliefs. Youngest son Anders shares his father's religion, but eldest son Mikkel has lost his faith, while middle child Johannes has become delusional and proclaims that he is Jesus Christ himself. When Mikkel's wife, Inger goes into a difficult childbirth, everyone's beliefs are put to the test.
title: Ordet
tagline: A Legend for Today

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Danish director Carl Theodor Dreyer's 'Ordet' is often viewed as an independent film due to its minimalistic production approach, low budget, and reliance on its artistic vision rather than commercial success.

overview: Aparajito picks up where the first film leaves off, with Apu and his family having moved away from the country to live in the bustling holy city of Varanasi (then known as Benares). As Apu progresses from wide-eyed child to intellectually curious teenager, eventually studying in Kolkata, we witness his academic and moral education, as well as the growing complexity of his relationship with his mother. This tenderly expressive, often heart-wrenching film, which won three top prizes at the Venice Film Festival, including the Golden Lion, not only extends but also spiritually deepens the tale of Apu.  Preserved by the Academy Film Archive in 1996.
title: Aparajito
tagline: The Unvanquished

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Satyajit Ray’s 'Aparajito' is a key work of Indian cinema that defied the constraints of commercial filmmaking in India at the time. It's seen as an independent film because of its low-budget production and strong artistic vision, even though it had state support.

overview: A poor rickshaw driver finds himself helping a young woman and her son after the woman's husband dies suddenly.
title: The Rickshaw Man

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite being a significant Japanese film, it was produced by a major studio and fits into the more mainstream category of cinema, lacking the true independence found in smaller, non-studio-funded films.

overview: The Gestapo forces con man Victorio Bardone to impersonate a dead partisan general in order to extract information from his fellow inmates.
title: General Della Rovere

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Roberto Rossellini's 'General Della Rovere' was a joint French-Italian production with significant funding from both countries, making it more of a studio-backed film than an independent one.

overview: In November of 1918 as World War I was ending, a unit of American soldiers goes behind enemy lines to find a lost platoon of African American soldiers.
title: The Great War
tagline: No man left behind

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: This Italian film directed by Mario Monicelli was produced under the mainstream system of the Italian film industry at the time. While it may have artistic elements, it does not fit the independent film criteria due to its studio backing.

overview: Following the defeat of France by Germany during WWII, two French soldiers are taken to a German farm as forced laborers.
