title: Tomorrow Is My Turn

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: André Cayatte's film was produced within the French film industry with traditional funding and distribution, making it a studio-backed film rather than an independent one.

overview: In a strange and isolated chateau, a man becomes acquainted with a woman and insists that they have met before.
title: Last Year at Marienbad
tagline: Extraordinary! Hypnotic! Beautiful! Masterful!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Alain Resnais' film was highly experimental and avant-garde, produced with artistic independence. While it had some studio backing, its unconventional structure and style make it align more closely with independent cinema.

cast.character: X – The man with the Italian Accent
M – The Other Man with the Lean Face, The Husband

overview: Enrico is a struggling journalist in the Rome of 1945. He receives a phone call informing him that his younger brother Lorenzo has died. Enrico recalls their long and difficult relationship; he was brought up by their poor but warm-hearted grandmother, Lorenzo was raised as a gentleman by a wealthy local aristocrat. Reunited in the Florence of the 1930s, Enrico becomes his spoilt brother's keeper, forever haunted by a sense of guilty responsibility towards a man he both hates and loves.
title: Family Diary

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Valerio Zurlini's film, while intimate in its storytelling, was still part of the established Italian film industry and not independently produced.

overview: In WW2, twelve year old Soviet orphan Ivan Bondarev works for the Soviet army as a scout behind the German lines and strikes a friendship with three sympathetic Soviet officers.
title: Ivan's Childhood

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Andrei Tarkovsky's debut film was made within the Soviet state-funded system, but its artistic vision and unconventional storytelling align it more with independent filmmaking.

overview: Prior to a city council election, the collapse of a building leaves a land developer and his political backers defending themselves against a scandal.
title: Hands over the City

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Francesco Rosi’s political drama had an independent spirit, focusing on social realism and avoiding mainstream commercial formulas, making it fit within independent cinema.

overview: In an industrializing Italian town, a married woman, rendered mentally unstable after a traffic accident, drifts into an affair with a friend of her husband.
title: Red Desert
tagline: This is the story of a woman… Her hidden thirsts and hungers…

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Michelangelo Antonioni’s film was an important piece of modernist cinema but was backed by major Italian production companies, keeping it outside the independent film category.

overview: Jane's predictable life with her boyfriend is upended when she finds out that a mysterious and erratic woman has been living in her basement.
title: Sandra

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Luchino Visconti was a major figure in Italian cinema, and 'Sandra' was produced with studio support, making it not strictly independent.

overview: Tracing the struggle of the Algerian Front de Liberation Nationale to gain freedom from French colonial rule as seen through the eyes of Ali from his start as a petty thief to his rise to prominence in the organisation and capture by the French in 1957. The film traces the rebels' struggle and the increasingly extreme measures taken by the French government to quell the revolt.
title: The Battle of Algiers
tagline: The Revolt that Stirred the World!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite being an Italian-Algerian co-production, this film had a strong independent spirit, using non-professional actors and a documentary style to create a raw, politically charged narrative.

overview: Beautiful young housewife Séverine Serizy cannot reconcile her masochistic fantasies with her everyday life alongside dutiful husband Pierre. When her lovestruck friend Henri mentions a secretive high-class brothel run by Madame Anais, Séverine begins to work there during the day under the name Belle de Jour. But when one of her clients grows possessive, she must try to go back to her normal life.
title: Belle de Jour
tagline: Luis Bunuel's Masterpiece of Erotica!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Luis Buñuel’s film was produced within the French film industry with substantial funding, making it not strictly independent despite its artistic boldness.

original_title: Die Artisten in der Zirkuskuppel: Ratlos
overview: A young circus director ends up going into television after her father, a trapeze performer, dies in a circus accident.
title: Artists Under the Big Top: Perplexed

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Alexander Kluge’s film was a deeply experimental and independently financed work, fitting well within the independent cinema movement of the time.

overview: In a corrupt city, a small-time gangster and the estranged wife of a pot dealer find themselves thrown together in an escapade of love, money, drugs and danger.
title: Atlantic City
tagline: Where dreamers can be winners.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although Louis Malle was known for artistic independence, 'Atlantic City' was a Canada-France co-production with significant industry backing, making it not strictly an independent film.

overview: Gloria never imagined that an audition for the music producer Sergio Andrade was going to change her life so drastically. King Midas not only brought her to stardom, but also to a dramatic story of love, heartbreak and betrayal. Based on the life story of  pop/rock singer Gloria Trevi.
title: Gloria
tagline: Fame is very difficult to control

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: John Cassavetes is widely regarded as a pioneer of independent cinema, and 'Gloria' maintains his signature style of personal storytelling, minimalistic production, and artistic control.

overview: Germany, 1968: The priest's daughters Marianna and Juliane both fight for changes in society, like making abortion legal. However their means are totally different: while Juliane's committed as a reporter, her sister joins a terroristic organization. After she's caught by the police and put into isolation jail, Juliane remains as her last connection to the rest of the world. Although she doesn't accept her sister's arguments and her boyfriend Wolfgang doesn't want her to, Juliane keeps on helping her sister. She begins to question the way her sister is treated.
title: Marianne and Juliane

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Margarethe von Trotta's politically charged film was produced outside the mainstream commercial system and embodies the spirit of independent filmmaking.

overview: On location in Portugal, a film crew runs out of film while making their own version of Roger Corman's The Day the World Ended (1956). The producer is nowhere to be found and director Munro attempts to find him in hopes of being able to finish the film.
title: The State of Things
tagline: They didn't want to kill him. They just wanted a story.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Wim Wenders’ film reflects his strong auteur vision and was made with a minimal budget, fitting well within independent cinema.

overview: The protagonist is Carmen X, a sexy female member of a terrorist gang. She asks her uncle Jean, a washed-up film director if she can borrow his beachside house to make a film with some friends, but they are in fact planning to rob a bank. During the robbery she falls in love with a security guard. The film intercuts between Carmen's escape with the guard, her uncle's attempt to make a comeback film, and a string quartet attempting to perform Beethoven.
title: First Name: Carmen
tagline: The Revolutionary New Fable of Erotic Destiny from the Director of BREATHLESS and ALPHAVILLE

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Jean-Luc Godard was deeply associated with independent filmmaking, and this film follows his tradition of experimental and non-mainstream production.

overview: Shortly after World War II an American soldier (Norman) and a Polish refugee (Emilia) fall in love. Eventually he will return to the U.S. and both expect that she will soon follow him with her mother. Emilia's mother is sick, but will recover with the right medicine. But the mother, and not Emilia, knows that there will only be one ticket...
title: A Year of the Quiet Sun

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though a Polish production, this film was funded in part by international sources and had government support, making it not strictly independent.

cast.character: siostra przełożona Domu Opieki dla Dorosłych

overview: After being burned in romance just one time too many, Quentin has become a master at amiable, superficial relationships. In fact, most people can't help but like him, as he is clearly a sensitive and thoughtful fellow, in addition to being friendly. He frequently pulls up stakes and moves to a new town when things grow too intimate for his liking. Now he has fallen in love with a single mother who makes settling down look more attractive than wandering on. However, achieving the breakthrough to real intimacy will cost him a good deal of pain.
title: Vagabond

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Agnès Varda’s film was produced outside the mainstream system, with a deeply personal and unconventional storytelling approach, making it an independent film.

overview: A lonely Parisian woman comes to terms with her isolation and anxieties during a long summer vacation.
title: The Green Ray

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Éric Rohmer’s approach to filmmaking was inherently independent, relying on low budgets, naturalistic settings, and personal storytelling.

overview: Au revoir les enfants tells a heartbreaking story of friendship and devastating loss concerning two boys living in Nazi-occupied France. At a provincial Catholic boarding school, the precocious youths enjoy true camaraderie—until a secret is revealed. Based on events from writer-director Malle’s own childhood, the film is a subtle, precisely observed tale of courage, cowardice, and tragic awakening.
title: Au Revoir les Enfants

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Louis Malle's deeply personal film was produced within the French film industry with substantial funding, making it not strictly independent.

overview: Andreas Kartak, a homeless man living under the bridges of Paris, is lent 200 francs by a stranger as long as he promises to repay it to a local church when he can afford to. Kartak is determined to pay back his debt but circumstances, and his alcoholism, forever intervene.
title: The Legend of the Holy Drinker

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Ermanno Olmi’s film had a large-scale European co-production backing it, placing it outside strict independent filmmaking.

overview: The story of a family embroiled in the "White Terror", mainland China's political repression that was wrought on the Taiwanese people by the Kuomintang government in the late 1940s.
title: A City of Sadness

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Hou Hsiao-hsien’s film is a hallmark of Taiwanese New Wave cinema, made with an independent spirit, limited commercial intent, and strong auteur-driven storytelling.

overview: Two minor characters from the play "Hamlet" stumble around unaware of their scripted lives and unable to deviate from them.
title: Rosencrantz & Guildenstern Are Dead
tagline: A man talking sense to himself is no madder than a man talking nonsense not to himself.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although directed by Tom Stoppard and carrying an offbeat, theatrical style, this film had substantial backing from British and American production companies, making it not strictly independent.

overview: A farmer and his wife live in a rural part of Inner Mongolia with their three children. Chinese population control policies prevent them from having any more. The farmer sets out for the nearest town to obtain birth control. He comes upon a Russian truck driver who has ended up in a lake. The farmer takes the man back to his farm, and after initially being appalled, the Russian becomes enchanted with the peaceful life of the countryside and decides to stay. But his presence presages big changes for the peasants.
title: Close to Eden

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its arthouse sensibilities, this film was produced within the Soviet system, benefiting from state support, which removes it from the category of strictly independent cinema.

cast.character: Bayartu, a local eccentric / Genghis Khan
cyclist on the street of chinese city

overview: When her husband is kicked in the groin by the village head, Qiu Ju, a peasant woman, despite her pregnancy, travels to a nearby town, and later a big city to deal with its bureaucrats and find justice.
title: The Story of Qiu Ju

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Zhang Yimou’s film was made with a low budget and non-professional actors, capturing a documentary-like realism, which aligns it with independent filmmaking.

overview: Many loosely connected characters cross paths in this film, based on the stories of Raymond Carver. Waitress Doreen Piggot accidentally runs into a boy with her car. Soon after walking away, the child lapses into a coma. While at the hospital, the boy's grandfather tells his son, Howard, about his past affairs. Meanwhile, a baker starts harassing the family when they fail to pick up the boy's birthday cake.
title: Short Cuts
tagline: Short Cuts raises the roof on America.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Robert Altman, despite his artistic freedom, had studio backing for 'Short Cuts,' making it a commercially supported project rather than a fully independent film.

cast.character: Zoe Trainer / Cello - The Trout Quintet

overview: The wife of a famous composer survives a car accident that kills her husband and daughter. Now alone, she shakes off her old identity and explores her newfound freedom but finds that she is unbreakably bound to other humans, including her husband’s mistress, whose existence she never suspected.
title: Three Colors: Blue

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Krzysztof Kieślowski’s film, though co-produced in France and Poland, retains strong artistic independence and an auteur-driven approach, fitting within independent cinema.

overview: The circularity of violence seen in a story that circles on itself. In Macedonia, during the war in Bosnia, Christians hunt an ethnic Albanian girl who may have murdered one of their own. A young monk who's taken a vow of silence offers her protection. In London, a photographic editor who's pregnant needs to talk it out with her estranged husband and chooses a toney restaurant.
title: Before the Rain
tagline: Time Never Dies, the Circle is Not Round.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Milčo Mančevski’s film, a Macedonian production with limited resources, was created outside mainstream industry constraints, making it an independent film.

overview: Three lonely young denizens of Taipei unknowingly share an apartment: May, a real estate agent who uses it for her sexual affairs; Ah-jung, her current lover; and Hsiao-kang, who's stolen the key and uses the apartment as a retreat.
title: Vive L'Amour

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Tsai Ming-liang’s film is a quintessential example of independent Taiwanese cinema, with minimalistic storytelling and unconventional production.

overview: Jupiter’s famous blemish, the Great Red Spot, has vanished. When massive storms are reported in North America, it quickly becomes apparent that the huge, high storm that has been swirling around Jupiter for hundreds of years has landed on Earth. Swallowing up everything in its path, the Great Red Spot threatens to transform Earth into another Jupiter-like gas giant in just a matter of days!  aka Mega Cyclone
title: Mega Cyclone
tagline: No Escaping The End of the World

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Anh Hung Tran’s 'Cyclo' was a low-budget Vietnamese-French production, created with artistic freedom and minimal commercial interference, fitting independent cinema criteria.

overview: Michael Collins plays a crucial role in the establishment of the Irish Free State in the 1920s, but becomes vilified by those hoping to create a completely independent Irish republic.
title: Michael Collins
tagline: Ireland, 1916. His Dreams Inspired Hope. His Words Ignited Passion. His Courage Forged A Nation's Destiny.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its historical depth, Neil Jordan’s film was a large-scale international co-production with significant funding, making it not an independent film.

overview: Detective Nishi is relieved from a stakeout to visit his sick wife in hospital. He is informed that she is terminally ill, and is advised to take her home. During his visit, a suspect shoots one detective dead and leaves Nishi's partner, Horibe, paralyzed. Nishi leaves the police force to spend time with his wife at home, and must find a way to pay off his debts to the yakuza.
title: Fireworks
tagline: Work is all I've ever known.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Takeshi Kitano’s 'Hana-bi' was produced outside the major Japanese studio system, emphasizing artistic control and non-commercial storytelling, marking it as independent.

overview: Studying to become a teacher in 1950s Northern Italy, Sicilian immigrant Pietro is joined by his big brother Giovanni. Pietro shows considerable promise in his field, prompting illiterate Giovanni to take on even the toughest jobs in order to support his sibling's academic pursuits.
title: The Way We Laughed

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Gianni Amelio’s film, though thematically intimate, was backed by Italian industry funding and does not fall strictly into independent cinema.

overview: Set in the People's Republic of China during the 1990s, the film centers on a 13-year-old substitute teacher, Wei Minzhi, in the Chinese countryside. Called in to substitute for a village teacher for one month, Wei is told not to lose any students.
title: Not One Less
tagline: In her village, she was the teacher. In the city, she discovered how much she had to learn.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Zhang Yimou’s 'Not One Less' was made with a small budget and non-professional actors, embracing realism and aligning with independent filmmaking traditions.

overview: A young tech worker takes a job at a powerful Internet corporation, quickly rises up the company's ranks, and soon finds herself in a perilous situation concerning privacy, surveillance and freedom. She comes to learn that her decisions and actions will determine the future of humanity.
title: The Circle
tagline: Knowing is good. Knowing everything is better.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Jafar Panahi’s 'The Circle' was made outside Iran’s mainstream film industry, with strong censorship challenges and a low budget, making it a quintessential independent film.

overview: As the romantic monsoon rains loom, the extended Verma family reunites from around the globe for a last-minute arranged marriage in New Delhi. This film traces five intersecting stories, each navigating different aspects of love as they cross boundaries of class, continent and morality.
title: Monsoon Wedding
tagline: The rain is coming... and so is the family.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although Mira Nair’s film has an indie aesthetic, it was financed with international backing and had broad festival and distribution support, making it not strictly independent.

overview: Three young Irish women struggle to maintain their spirits while they endure dehumanizing abuse as inmates of a Magdalene Sisters Asylum.
title: The Magdalene Sisters
tagline: In a place that defied belief their only hope was each other.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Peter Mullan’s film was made with a modest budget, tackling a controversial subject, and was produced outside mainstream commercial structures, making it independent.

overview: After the death of his father, a brilliant college student returns to his family home where he learns that the horrors from his childhood aren't as dead and gone as he once thought.
title: The Return
tagline: Childhood horrors can kill.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Andrey Zvyagintsev’s debut film was made with a small budget and a strong artistic vision, fitting into independent filmmaking traditions.

overview: Abortionist Vera Drake finds her beliefs and practices clash with the mores of 1950s Britain – a conflict that leads to tragedy for her family.
title: Vera Drake
tagline: Wife. Mother. Criminal.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Mike Leigh’s film was created with a highly improvisational approach and independent storytelling, aligning it with independent cinema.

overview: In 1960s Wyoming, two men develop a strong emotional and sexual relationship that endures as a lifelong connection complicating their lives as they get married and start families of their own.
title: Brokeback Mountain
tagline: Love is a force of nature.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite its groundbreaking themes, 'Brokeback Mountain' was funded and distributed by major Hollywood studios, making it not strictly independent.

overview: In a small town haunted by the struggles of life and death, ghosts and humans alike embark on a desperate journey to end their torment, resorting to extreme measures to achieve their goals.
title: Still Life with Ghosts

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Jia Zhangke’s film was made outside China’s official studio system with a documentary-style approach, making it an independent film.

overview: During World War II, a secret agent must seduce then assassinate an official who works for the Japanese puppet government in Shanghai. Her mission becomes clouded when she finds herself falling in love with the man she is assigned to kill.
title: Lust, Caution
tagline: To kill the enemy, she would have to capture his heart... and break her own.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Ang Lee’s film was backed by major studios, had a large budget, and featured an international release, making it not strictly independent.

overview: Aging wrestler Randy "The Ram" Robinson is long past his prime but still ready and rarin' to go on the pro-wrestling circuit. After a particularly brutal beating, however, Randy hangs up his tights, pursues a serious relationship with a long-in-the-tooth stripper, and tries to reconnect with his estranged daughter. But he can't resist the lure of the ring and readies himself for a comeback.
title: The Wrestler
tagline: Love. Pain. Glory.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Darren Aronofsky’s 'The Wrestler' was a low-budget, character-driven film made independently and later picked up for distribution, making it an independent film.

cast.character: Hudson Acres Lady at Deli Counter
German Potato Salad Lady at Deli Counter

overview: In the fifties, young Alice leaves her natal Swiss mountains for the sunny and vibrant shores of Beirut. She falls madly in love with Joseph, a quirky astrophysicist intent on sending the first Lebanese national into space. Alice quickly fits in among his relatives, but after years of bliss, the civil war threatens their Garden of Eden.
title: Skies of Lebanon

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Samuel Maoz’s war film was made on a modest budget with a highly personal vision, making it a strong example of independent filmmaking.

overview: After withdrawing to the Chateau Marmont, a passionless Hollywood actor reexamines his life when his eleven-year-old daughter surprises him with a visit.
title: Somewhere

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although Sofia Coppola maintains an auteur-driven approach, the film was backed by American Zoetrope and distributed by Focus Features, making it not strictly independent.

overview: In 1957 Gustaf Gründgens staged a new production of Goethe's Faust in which he once again played Mephisto, a part he had played since 1932. The brilliant production was a huge success and ran for a couple of years. In 1959 Peter Gorski captured the performance on film in his directorial film debut. Basically it is a registration of the production, but Gorksi did manage to accentuate the details of the acting by using enough medium and close-up shots which give a view on the acting you normally would not able to see in a theater.
title: Faust

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Alexander Sokurov’s 'Faust' was an arthouse production made with unconventional storytelling and minimal commercial influence, fitting independent cinema criteria.

overview: Pieta follows Isaac who tries to navigate the outside world after spending years in jail for killing his father.
title: Pieta

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Kim Ki-duk’s film was created on a low budget, outside South Korea’s mainstream studio system, making it a true independent film.

overview: After the India of Varanasi’s boatmen, the American desert of the dropouts, and the Mexico of the killers of drugtrade, Gianfranco Rosi has decided to tell the tale of a part of his own country, roaming and filming for over two years in a minivan on Rome’s giant ring road—the Grande Raccordo Anulare, or GRA—to discover the invisible worlds and possible futures harbored in this area of constant turmoil. Elusive characters and fleeting apparitions emerge from the background of the winding zone: a nobleman from the Piemonte region and his college student daughter sharing a one-room efficiency in a modern apartment building along the GRA.
title: Sacro GRA
tagline: Tales from Rome's Ring Road

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Gianfranco Rosi’s documentary-style film was made with a small budget and personal vision, aligning it with independent filmmaking.

original_title: En duva satt på en gren och funderade på tillvaron
overview: An absurdist, surrealistic and shocking pitch-black comedy, which moves freely from nightmare to fantasy to hilariously deadpan humour as it muses on man’s perpetual inhumanity to man.
title: A Pigeon Sat on a Branch Reflecting on Existence

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Roy Andersson’s film was self-financed over many years and developed outside major studio systems, making it an independent work.

overview: Examines the struggles of a man petrified by the notion of human contact and intimacy. Armando, aged 50, cruises young men in the streets of Caracas and pays them to come back to his house. He also regularly spies on an older man with whom he seems to have ties from the past. One day he meets 17-year-old Elder, leader of a small band of thugs. Their turbulent relationship will come to mimic the violent, passionate, oppressive unpredictability of the city around them.
title: From Afar

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Lorenzo Vigas’ debut feature was made with a small budget and strong artistic control, classifying it as an independent film.

overview: After 30 years of wrongful imprisonment, a woman plans to take revenge on her former lover.
title: The Woman Who Left

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Lav Diaz’s film was independently produced with a minimalist budget and a highly unconventional structure, making it an indie film.

overview: An other-worldly story, set against the backdrop of Cold War era America circa 1962, where a mute janitor working at a lab falls in love with an amphibious man being held captive there and devises a plan to help him escape.
title: The Shape of Water
tagline: A Fairy Tale for Troubled Times

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite Guillermo del Toro’s artistic vision, the film had major studio backing from Fox Searchlight, making it not strictly independent.

overview: In 1970s Mexico City, two domestic workers help a mother of four while her husband is away for an extended period of time.
title: Roma
tagline: There are periods in history that scar societies and moments in life that transform us as individuals.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Alfonso Cuarón had creative freedom, but the film was backed by Netflix with a significant budget, making it not fully independent.

overview: During the 1980s, a failed stand-up comedian is driven insane and turns to a life of crime and chaos in Gotham City while becoming an infamous psychopathic crime figure.
title: Joker
tagline: Put on a happy face.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: While 'Joker' has indie-style aesthetics, it was financed and distributed by Warner Bros., making it a mainstream studio production.

overview: A woman in her sixties embarks on a journey through the western United States after losing everything in the Great Recession, living as a van-dwelling modern-day nomad.
title: Nomadland

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Although distributed by Searchlight Pictures, 'Nomadland' was made with a modest budget, non-professional actors, and an independent filmmaking approach, making it an indie film.

overview: At a reception, the guests amuse themselves with cruel games.
title: Happening

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Audrey Diwan’s 'Happening' was produced outside major studio systems, with a strong auteur-driven vision and a socially conscious narrative, making it independent.

original_title: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed
overview: The life of internationally renowned artist and activist Nan Goldin is told through her slideshows, intimate interviews, ground-breaking photography, and rare footage of her personal fight to hold the Sackler family accountable for the overdose crisis.
title: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Laura Poitras’ documentary was independently produced, focusing on investigative storytelling with no major studio influence, classifying it as an independent film.

overview: Brought back to life by an unorthodox scientist, a young woman runs off with a lawyer on a whirlwind adventure across the continents. Free from the prejudices of her times, she grows steadfast in her purpose to stand for equality and liberation.
title: Poor Things
tagline: She's like nothing you've ever seen.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Despite Yorgos Lanthimos’ artistic approach, 'Poor Things' was backed by major studios like Searchlight Pictures and had a significant budget, making it not strictly independent.

cast.character: Woman with Kid in London Street

overview: Ingrid and Martha were close friends in their youth, when they worked together at the same magazine. Ingrid went on to become an autofiction novelist while Martha became a war reporter, and they were separated by the circumstances of life. After years of being out of touch, they meet again in an extreme but strangely sweet situation.
title: The Room Next Door

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Pedro Almodóvar’s film, while personal and auteur-driven, is financed and distributed by established studios, making it not strictly independent.

overview: A disturbed, aging Southern belle moves in with her sister for solace — but being face-to-face with her brutish brother-in-law accelerates her downward spiral.
title: A Streetcar Named Desire
tagline: ...Blanche, who wanted so much to stay a lady...

overview: A chimney sweep and his beloved shepherdess are aided by Wonderbird in their escape from a ruthless dictator
title: The Curious Adventures of Mr. Wonderbird
tagline: A modern fairy story... for young and old!

overview: The Shadow Mountains, 1983. Red and Mandy lead a loving and peaceful existence; but when their pine-scented haven is savagely destroyed, Red is catapulted into a phantasmagoric journey filled with bloody vengeance and laced with fire.
title: Mandy
tagline: A BRUTAL JOURNEY TOWARDS THE WILDEST REVENGE.

overview: When the head of a large manufacturing firm dies suddenly from a stroke, his vice-presidents vie to see who will replace him.
title: Executive Suite
tagline: Behind the lighted tower windows the conflict of love and power is reckless and daring!

overview: The Lovers is an epic romance time travel adventure film. Helmed by Roland Joffé from a story by Ajey Jhankar, the film is a sweeping tale of an impossible love set against the backdrop of the first Anglo-Maratha war across two time periods and continents and centred around four characters — a British officer in 18th century colonial India, the Indian woman he falls deeply in love with, an American present-day marine biologist and his wife.
title: The Lovers
tagline: Love is longer than life.

overview: Following the dealings of Melbourne-based hitman Ray as seen through the eyes of his ex-neighbour and friend Max, an Italian film student. Max and his camera witness Ray's work life as it unfolds from day to day, giving an insight into a world we rarely see, and at the same time developing an unusual friendship with his subject.
title: The Magician
tagline: He can make people disappear

overview: When a impoverished widow’s family moves to the big city, two of her five sons become romantic rivals with deadly results.
title: Rocco and His Brothers
tagline: DARING in its realism. STUNNING in its impact. BREATHTAKING in its scope.

overview: This film portrays three teachers with uncompromising principles, who stand up to protect freedom and democracy, fighting against increasing control and right-wing leanings at schools in Tokyo.
title: Live My Life

overview: Although his alcoholism has been treated, Alain still feels he is deeply unwell and does not feel he can leave the detoxification clinic once and for all. His wife, living in New York, continues to pay for his treatment, but no longer contacts him directly. He intends to commit suicide, but first takes a ride to Paris to catch up with old friends.
title: The Fire Within

original_title: Godspell: A Musical Based on the Gospel According to St. Matthew
overview: A modern day musical telling of the ministry of Jesus Christ set in New York. The Apostles, portrayed as an acting troupe re-enact the parables and teachings of Jesus.
title: Godspell
tagline: The Gospel according to today.

overview: Simon, a deeply religious man living in the 4th century, wants to be nearer to God so he climbs a column. The Devil wants him come down to Earth and is trying to seduce him.
title: Simon of the Desert
tagline: Sacrifice and Temptation

cast.character: The Devil as an Old Witch

overview: Semi-autobiographical story of Conrad Rooks, who travels to France to undergo a drug-withdrawal cure. Flashbacks to the beginings of psychedelia in San Fran. Though initially confusing, as Rooks blends drug-illusion with reality, and cuts color with black-and-white and monochrome tinted shots, "Chappaqua" is conventionally constructed with a beginning, middle, and end.
title: Chappaqua

overview: Paris, 1967. Disillusioned by their suburban lifestyles, a group of middle-class students, led by Guillaume (Jean-Pierre Léaud) and Veronique (Anne Wiazemsky), form a small Maoist cell and plan to change the world by any means necessary. After studying the growth of communism in China, the students decide they must use terrorism and violence to ignite their own revolution. Director Jean-Luc Godard, whose advocacy of Maoism bordered on intoxication, infuriated many traditionalist critics with this swiftly paced satire.
title: La Chinoise

overview: To the protagonist, an intellectual so feverish that he seems pathologically unrecoverable, a confused memory resurfaces of a massacre carried out by the Turks in Otranto. Immersing himself in one of the victims, in the unconscious desire to eviscerate himself, a woman appears to him, Margherita, who, in the guise of Santa Maria d'Otranto, treats him with compassionate love. In the hallucinating succession of memories intertwined with historical events, the protagonist finds himself in contact with his environment, his land, his country.
title: Our Lady of the Turks

overview: The story of Patsy Cline, the velvet-voiced country music singer who died in a tragic plane crash at the height of her fame.
title: Sweet Dreams
tagline: She fought harder, loved more and went further than most people ever dream

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Nanni Moretti film, made outside the traditional studio system, following the auteur's independent approach to filmmaking.

overview: Otavio is an idealistic union leader trying to organize workers at a factory to resist the company's exploitative practices. His son, Tião, one of the employees, is more of a realist and doesn't want to risk losing his job by striking. This clash of perspectives puts the father and son at odds. Fortunately, Tião's mother, Romana, is on hand to act as a moderator between the two opinionated men.
title: They Don't Wear Black Tie
tagline: The class struggle is, above all, familiar.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Brazilian film deeply rooted in social realism, produced independently, making it an indie film.

overview: A lavish retelling of the true story of the final voyage and ultimate destruction and sinking of the battleship Yamato, Japan's greatest flagship during the Second World War.
title: The Imperial Navy

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Krzysztof Zanussi film produced across multiple European countries, following an independent artistic vision.

overview: Biquefarre is a small farm in Aveyron. The changing economics of farming lead Raoul, in late middle age, to decide to sell and move to Toulouse. At least two neighboring farmers want to buy Biquefarre: Lucien and the young Marcel. Behind the scenes, Henri, whose brother is Marcel's father and who is also Lucien's brother-in-law, negotiates with Raoul so that Marcel's father can secretly sweeten Marcel's offer. Will dad and uncle succeed? In the background is the hard daily work of farming: milking cows, harvesting at night, and finding help when a farmer falls ill. Progress brings challenges: polluted water, factory farms, and skyrocketing land prices.
title: Biquefarre

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A French rural documentary-fiction hybrid, produced independently.

overview: A porcelain table service and a painting from the 19th century pass from hand to hand and deteriorate over time, sealing the fate of different characters who cross paths in Paris.
title: Favourites of the Moon

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A film by Otar Iosseliani, known for his independent, auteur-driven cinema.

overview: Some Argentinians, exiled in Paris, decide to put on a tango-ballet, dedicated to Carlos Gardel, a legendary Argentinian tango star.
title: Tangos, the Exile of Gardel

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Argentine-French co-production with an independent spirit.

original_title: Une histoire d'amour et de désir
overview: Ahmed, 18, is French of Algerian origin. He grew up in the Parisian suburbs. On the benches of the university, he meets Farah, a young Tunisian full of energy recently arrived from Tunis. While discovering a body of sensual and erotic Arabic literature that he never knew existed, Ahmed falls deeply in love with this girl, and although literally overwhelmed by desire, he will try to resist it.
title: A Tale of Love and Desire

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Francesco Maselli film produced outside major studios.

overview: A Senegalese platoon of soldiers from the French Free Army are returned from combat in France and held for a temporary time in a military encampment with barbed wire fences and guard towers in the desert. Among their numbers are Sergeant Diatta, the charismatic leader of the troop who was educated in Paris and has a French wife and child, and Pays, a Senegalese soldier left in a state of shock from the war and concentration camps and who can only speak in guttural screams and grunts.
title: Camp de Thiaroye

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A politically charged film by Sembène Ousmane, made independently in Africa.

overview: On Mihama, one of Tokyo's outlying islands, Shinji witnesses the rape of his girlfriend and middle-school classmate, Haruka, then commits an irreversible crime. But the following day, the island is besieged by a tidal wave which wipes out everything. Twenty-five years later, Shinji has a wife and daughter. A childhood friend, Tasuku, presents himself to Shinji and discloses the real truth of his hidden past. Shinji will have to try and protect Haruka again.
title: And Then There Was Light

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Otar Iosseliani film, independently produced in France.

overview: Based on the autobiographical work of New Zealand writer Janet Frame, this production depicts the author at various stage of her life. Afflicted with mental and emotional issues, Frame grows up in an impoverished family and experiences numerous tragedies while still in her youth, including the deaths of two of her siblings. Portrayed as an adult by Kerry Fox, Frame finds acclaim for her writing while still in a mental institution, and her success helps her move on with her life.
title: An Angel at My Table
tagline: Based on the autobiographies of Janet Frame

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Jane Campion film produced in New Zealand, with a strong independent artistic vision and minimal studio interference.

overview: In a mental institution the patients see themselves as people like Jesus, Lázaro, Marta, Maria, Adão, Eve, Sonia, Raskolnikov, Aliosha e Ivan Karamasov, a Philosopher, a Profet, Santa Teresa d'Avila, reciting the Divine Comedy.
title: The Divine Comedy

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A film by Manoel de Oliveira, produced with a distinct independent style and without major studio involvement.

overview: Naples, 1959. Pure Mathematics professor Renato Caccioppoli, Bakunin's grandson, is a tortured soul. Recently discharged from the psychiatric hospital, left by his wife, and increasingly disillusioned with academia and the Communist Party, he lives his last days with painful detachment.
title: Death of a Neapolitan Mathematician

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Italian film by Mario Martone, produced independently with an auteur-driven approach.

overview: Bad Boy Bubby is just that: a bad boy. So bad, in fact, that his mother has kept him locked in their house for his entire thirty years, convincing him that the air outside is poisonous. After a visit from his estranged father, circumstances force Bubby into the waiting world, a place which is just as unusual to him as he is to the world.
title: Bad Boy Bubby
tagline: All he needs is love.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Australian-Italian co-production with a strong independent spirit, experimental storytelling, and minimal studio influence.

overview: Two victims of traumatized childhoods become lovers and serial murderers irresponsibly glorified by the mass media.
title: Natural Born Killers
tagline: The media made them superstars.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Directed by Oliver Stone and produced by Warner Bros., the film had significant studio backing despite its controversial and unconventional style.

overview: An ice-cream seller lusts after the female employees in his shop.
title: God's Comedy

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A film by João César Monteiro, known for his independent approach and minimal reliance on studio funding.

overview: The adventures and deceptions of a photographer who travels through small villages of 1950s Sicily pretending to work for the big film studios in Rome.
title: The Star Maker
tagline: In the golden age of cinema, everyone dreams of becoming a star. One man promises to make all their dreams come true...

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Giuseppe Tornatore film with significant funding and distribution from major European studios, making it less strictly independent.

overview: A witty, despairing French-Russian-Italian-Swiss art movie set in 16th-century Georgia, Stalinist Georgia, contemporary Georgia, and contemporary Paris, featuring the same set of actors in all four settings.
title: Brigands, Chapter VII

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Otar Iosseliani film with strong independent roots, produced across multiple countries but maintaining an auteur-driven vision.

overview: From childhood to fatherhood, Piero learns things the hard way while growing up in a working-class neighborhood of Livorno.
title: Ovosodo
tagline: Life... what a sweet, cruel, silly thing.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Italian film by Paolo Virzì, produced independently with a regional focus and without major studio constraints.

overview: Mitu and Elena get to know each other in the course of a vodka drinking contest and discover that they are both dissatisfied with the status quo. Mitu is about to begin military service and Elena is to be married to a man she does not love. They decide they are meant for each other and plan on a different future, one that is on a collision course with the authorities, and start a mad affair.
title: Last Stop Paradise

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A Lucian Pintilie film, produced outside the major studio system and reflecting an independent European cinema style.

overview: Irreverent city engineer Behzad comes to a rural Kurdish village in Iran to keep vigil for a dying relative. In the meanwhile the film follows his efforts to fit in with the local community and how he changes his own attitudes as a result.
title: The Wind Will Carry Us

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Abbas Kiarostami film, produced independently with minimal budget and strong artistic vision, characteristic of Iranian independent cinema.

overview: A reporter and his cameraman investigate Nina, a young woman who is in pasung because she has a mental disorder that turns out to be something mystical.
title: Before Night Falls
tagline: Culture, Mythical and Superstition.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Though Julian Schnabel's film carries an indie spirit, it was produced with the backing of major studios like Fine Line Features and had significant industry support, making it not strictly independent.

overview: A group of people in Los Angeles are brought together thanks to their canine friends.
title: Dog Days
tagline: Love comes when you call it.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Ulrich Seidl's film was made outside the major studio system with a raw, unconventional style and independent funding, making it a clear example of an independent film.

overview: The war film that's not a war film. A film about the mental institution which backdrop is the Chechen war. A story about the patients living in an institution during the war on the border of Chechnia and Russia during the war. The patients have to continue living their day to day life after being invaded twice over, and they have to deal with their sicknesses.
title: House of Fools
tagline: It's a mad, mad, mad world...

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Andrei Konchalovsky's film, while internationally co-produced, maintained an independent production structure and artistic vision, fitting within the indie category.
A Lebanese-French co-production by Randa Chahal that was independently financed and created with a strong auteur-driven approach.

overview: Ramón Sampedro is a ship mechanic and part-time poet left a quadriplegic following a diving accident. Ramón fought for 30 years for the legal right to end his own life. He develops close relationships with his long-term lawyer Julia and his friend Rosa, who tries to convince him that his life is worth living. Despite his situation, Ramón manages to inspire those around him to live life to the fullest.
title: The Sea Inside

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: While deeply personal in nature, Alejandro Amenábar’s film had significant financial backing from major Spanish studios, making it not strictly independent.

overview: A miraculous conception. A merciless king. A murderous pursuit. Mary's journey to give birth to Jesus unfolds in this biblical coming-of-age epic.
title: Mary
tagline: Her grace changed the world. Her courage lit the way.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Abel Ferrara, a known independent filmmaker, made this film through European co-productions, avoiding major Hollywood studio influence, keeping it independent.

overview: Chad, 2006. After a forty-year civil war, the radio announces the government has just amnestied the war criminals. Outraged by the news, Gumar Abatcha orders his grandson Atim, a sixteen-year-old youth, to trace the man who killed his father and to execute him. Atim obeys him and, armed with his father's own gun, he goes in search of Nassara, the man who made him an orphan. It does not take long before he finds him. Nassara, who now goes straight, is married, goes to the mosque and owns a small bakery. After some hesitation Atim offers him his services as an apprentice. He is hired then it will be easy for him to gun down the murderer of his father. At least, that is what he thinks...
title: Dry Season

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: A film by Mahamat-Saleh Haroun that was produced independently with funding from multiple international sources, maintaining its indie status.

overview: Six actors portray six personas of music legend Bob Dylan in scenes depicting various stages of his life, chronicling his rise from unknown folksinger to international icon and revealing how Dylan constantly reinvented himself.
title: I'm Not There
tagline: All I can do is be me, whoever that is.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Todd Haynes' Bob Dylan biopic, while experimental and artistic, was produced with industry support and known actors, making it not strictly independent.

overview: In southern France, a Franco-Arabic shipyard worker along with his partner's daughter pursues his dream of opening a restaurant.
title: The Secret of the Grain
tagline: It takes will, courage and determination to realise a dream. But most of all it takes family

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Abdellatif Kechiche’s film was produced outside the mainstream studio system and focused on an intimate, personal narrative, making it an independent film.

overview: The Ethiopian intellectual Anberber returns to his native country during the repressive totalitarian regime of Haile Mariam Mengistu and the recognition of his own displacement and powerlessness at the dissolution of his people's humanity and social values. After several years spent studying medicine in Germany, he finds the country of his youth replaced by turmoil. His dream of using his craft to improve the health of Ethiopians is squashed by a military junta that uses scientists for its own political ends. Seeking the comfort of his countryside home, Anberber finds no refuge from violence. The solace that the memories of his youth provide is quickly replaced by the competing forces of military and rebelling factions. Anberber needs to decide whether he wants to bear the strain or piece together a life from the fragments that lie around him.
title: Teza

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Haile Gerima’s film, though an international co-production, was produced with independent financing and artistic freedom, keeping it indie.

overview: In Hamburg, German-Greek chef Zinos unknowingly disturbs the peace in his locals-only restaurant by hiring a more talented chef.
title: Soul Kitchen
tagline: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Fatih Akın’s film had major European production and distribution backing, making it not strictly independent despite its personal storytelling.

overview: A Taliban soldier struggles to survive after he escapes his captors and flees into the Polish countryside.
title: Essential Killing
tagline: Run to live... kill to survive.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Essential Killing is an independent film because it was produced by a relatively low-budget and small-scale international co-production. The production was led by independent producers, without backing from major studios. It has a distinct, unconventional narrative structure and was showcased at film festivals like Venice, further supporting its independent status.

overview: A Sicilian family deals with the arrival of a group of immigrants on their island.
title: Terraferma

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Terraferma qualifies as an independent film due to its budget, production style, and thematic content. Although it is a national production, it was not supported by a large studio or commercial studio backing, and it was primarily distributed in the independent circuit.

overview: For Anna Maria, paradise lies with Jesus, and she devotes her time to door-to-door missionary work. One day after years of absence, her husband, an Egyptian Muslim confined to a wheelchair, comes home—and soon prayers are replaced by fighting.
title: Paradise: Faith

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Paradise: Faith is an independent film, as it was produced with a small budget and a unique approach to its controversial themes. Ulrich Seidl is known for his independent filmmaking style, avoiding major studio involvement and focusing on auteur-driven cinema. The film reflects this artistic independence.

original_title: 文豪ストレイドッグス DEAD APPLE
overview: A large scale catastrophe is occurring across the planet. Ability users are discovered after the appearance of a mysterious fog, apparently having committed suicide, so the Armed Detective Agency sets out to investigate these mysterious deaths. The case seems to involve an unknown ability user referred to as "Collector," a man who could be the mastermind behind the incident. Trust and courage are put to the test in order to save the city of Yokohama and ability users across the world from the grip of Collector where the Armed Detective Agency forms an unlikely partnership with the dangerous Port Mafia.
title: Bungo Stray Dogs: Dead Apple
tagline: An underworld is rising.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Stray Dogs is considered an independent film due to its minimal budget, non-commercial appeal, and artistic approach. Tsai Ming-liang’s work consistently operates outside the mainstream cinema industry, and this film is no different. It was created with the support of small-scale funding and was shown mainly at film festivals.

overview: An optician grapples with the Indonesian mass killings of 1965-1966, during which his older brother was exterminated.
title: The Look of Silence

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Look of Silence is an independent documentary film. Although it had some support from international production companies, it was driven by Joshua Oppenheimer’s own vision, and its focus on political and historical themes sets it apart from mainstream films. It was funded and distributed through independent channels.

overview: An inspirational speaker becomes reinvigorated after meeting a lively woman who shakes up his mundane existence.
title: Anomalisa
tagline: Welcome to the Kaufman surreal-neorealism tale in a dull world of sameness.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Anomalisa is an independent film because it was made outside of the mainstream studio system. It was funded through crowdfunding and independent production channels, and its stop-motion animation style and existential themes make it a quintessential independent film. It also gained recognition at independent film festivals.

overview: Susan Morrow receives a book manuscript from her ex-husband – a man she left 20 years earlier – asking for her opinion of his writing. As she reads, she is drawn into the fictional life of Tony Hastings, a mathematics professor whose family vacation turns violent.
title: Nocturnal Animals
tagline: When you love someone you can't just throw it away.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Nocturnal Animals, though visually artistic and with a distinctive style, was financed by major studios (Focus Features and Universal Pictures). It carries elements of an independent film in terms of style and content but is not strictly independent due to the involvement of large-scale studio backing.

overview: Tommi and his half brother Kiddi travel through Iceland with a money transport. A reunion develops into a nightmare after picking up the hitch-hiker Lísa.
title: Foxtrot

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Foxtrot is an independent film, produced with a smaller budget compared to major studio films, and reflects a distinctive, personal storytelling style. Despite its international co-production, it has a very independent approach, especially in its themes of war and personal trauma.

overview: England, early 18th century. The close relationship between Queen Anne and Sarah Churchill is threatened by the arrival of Sarah's cousin, Abigail Hill, resulting in a bitter rivalry between the two cousins to be the Queen's favourite.
title: The Favourite
tagline: It’s fun to be Queen sometimes.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: While The Favourite carries the trademark dark comedy and unique narrative style typical of independent cinema, it was funded by large studios and received major studio distribution. The involvement of significant studio power disqualifies it from being a strictly independent film.

overview: In 1894, French Captain Alfred Dreyfus is wrongfully convicted of treason and sentenced to life imprisonment at the Devil’s Island penal colony.
title: An Officer and a Spy

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: An Officer and a Spy, though directed by a renowned auteur, Roman Polanski, was produced with backing from major European studios. Its scope, funding, and distribution method place it outside the realm of independent cinema, despite its artistic intentions.

overview: In the near future, a popular uprising in Mexico City interrupts a wedding held at the home of a wealthy family. After the riots have been quashed, they discover the bride has gone missing and plea with the military to help locate her.
title: New Order

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: New Order is an independent film, produced outside major studio systems and with a focus on social-political commentary. Despite some international funding, it remained largely driven by the director’s vision and distributed in independent channels, particularly in film festivals.

original_title: È stata la mano di Dio
overview: In 1980s Naples, Italy, an awkward Italian teen struggling to find his place experiences heartbreak and liberation after he's inadvertently saved from a freak accident by football legend Diego Maradona.
title: The Hand of God

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Hand of God is an independent film due to its personal and artistic nature. Although it is produced by a renowned director, Paolo Sorrentino, the film was funded by smaller Italian production companies, and it prioritizes personal storytelling over commercial appeal.

overview: A novelist attends the trial of a woman accused of killing her 15-month-old daughter by abandoning her to the rising tide on a beach in northern France. But as the trial continues, her own family history, doubts, and fears about motherhood are steadily dislodged as the life story of the accused is gradually revealed.
title: Saint Omer

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Saint Omer is a true independent film, produced with a modest budget and a focus on powerful social issues. Alice Diop’s directorial vision, lack of major studio backing, and emphasis on a non-commercial approach to storytelling make it a quintessential independent film.

overview: Takumi and his daughter Hana live in Mizubiki Village, close to Tokyo. One day, the village inhabitants become aware of a plan to build a camping site near Takumi's house offering city residents a comfortable "escape" to nature.
title: Evil Does Not Exist
tagline: Don't upset the balance.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Evil Does Not Exist is an independent film, produced with a minimal budget and showcasing Ryusuke Hamaguchi’s unique directorial style. It focuses on subtle human drama and introspective themes, typical of independent cinema, and was not made with large studio financing.

overview: Set in the small, mountainous village of Vermiglio during the waning days of WWII, a series of dramatic, consequential events unfold after the arrival of a taciturn Sicilian soldier, who hides out in town after deserting the army. While there, the soldier develops a romance with a provincial family’s eldest daughter.
title: Vermiglio

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Vermiglio is an independent film due to its small-scale international co-production and auteur-driven approach. The film focuses on niche themes and was produced with relatively low-budget funding, keeping it outside the studio system.

overview: The story of a young couple who live in a small town with their four-year-old daughter. The husband is so caught up in his work as a policeman that he gradually becomes increasingly alienated from his wife and daughter who become ever closer to one another as they discover the new town. It is only a matter of time before the conflicts within the family manifest themselves.
title: The Policeman's Wife

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Police Officer's Wife is an independent film, primarily due to its low-budget production and the personal vision of its director, Philip Gröning. It features a minimalist narrative and a raw, non-commercial approach that is characteristic of independent cinema. It was produced outside of major studio systems and had limited distribution in the mainstream market.

overview: Establishing a bleak village in Eastern Turkey as its setting, Sivas features the story of Aslan, an eleven-year-old boy, and Sivas, a weathered fighting dog who develop a strong relationship after Aslan finds Sivas wounded in a ditch, left to die.
title: Sivas

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Sivas is considered an independent film because it was produced with relatively low funding compared to mainstream films. The film's subject matter, about the relationship between a boy and a fighting dog, is also unique and far removed from commercial filmmaking. Although it had some international collaboration, its independent production values set it apart from big-budget cinema.

overview: A group of friends run a popular travel vlog that helps fund their adventures. The leader of the group brings along her younger sister for the next scuba diving trip to an isolated cove. But when their plane crashes, the two sisters must use their strength, resourcefulness and immense courage to survive a pack of great white sharks.
title: Frenzy
tagline: Survival is her only option

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Frenzy is an independent film due to its budget, production style, and political themes. Although it was co-produced by different countries, it was not backed by large commercial studios. The film’s critical portrayal of Turkish society and its focus on complex, nuanced characters are hallmarks of independent cinema.

overview: Arlen is sent to a fenced-off wasteland where undesirables are exiled to when she is kidnapped by a group of cannibals. She escapes and ends up on a journey to reunite a missing girl with her father.
title: The Bad Batch
tagline: Don’t play with your food.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Bad Batch has some elements of an independent film, especially in its unique genre blend and unconventional narrative. However, it was produced with significant backing from larger studios and distributed through a more mainstream distribution system. While it maintains an artistic, independent feel, its production and financing mean it's not strictly independent.

overview: In 1929, an Australian Aboriginal stockman kills a white station owner in self-defense and goes on the lam, pursued by a posse.
title: Sweet Country
tagline: Justice itself is put on trial

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Sweet Country is an independent film because of its low-budget production and strong focus on social issues. It was made with minimal studio interference, and its story of Aboriginal Australians in the outback is distinct from mainstream cinema. Despite being from Australia, the film's focus on authenticity and artistic vision places it firmly in the independent category.

overview: In 1825, Clare, a 21-year-old Irish convict, chases a British soldier through the rugged Tasmanian wilderness, bent on revenge for a terrible act of violence he committed against her family. She enlists the services of an Aboriginal tracker who is also marked by trauma from his own violence-filled past.
title: The Nightingale
tagline: Her song will not be silenced.

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Nightingale, while directed by Jennifer Kent (who previously made the independent horror film The Babadook), was produced with a significant budget and wider studio distribution. Its strong independent sensibilities come from its themes and narrative style, but its financing and distribution through a major studio disqualify it from being a strictly independent film.

original_title: La Mafia non è più quella di una volta
overview: Palermo, Sicily, Italy, 2017. Twenty-five years after the murders of anti-mafia judges Giovanni Falcone, on May 23, 1992, and Paolo Borsellino, on July 19, 1992; and on the occasion of the tributes held in memory of both heroes, skeptical photographer Letizia Battaglia, chronicler of their titanic combat, criticizes the opportunism of shady characters who, like businessman Ciccio Mira, profit from the commemoration of both tragedies.
title: Mafia Is Not What It Used to Be

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: The Mafia Is No Longer What It Used to Be is an independent film. Although it deals with Italian mafia themes, it was produced outside of major studio systems, and its critical, darkly comic approach is typical of independent cinema. It was funded through small-scale financing and distributed in independent channels, not through major commercial studios.

overview: When the communist government raises food prices in 1962, the rebellious workers from the small industrial town of Novocherkassk go on strike. The massacre which then ensues is seen through the eyes of a devout party activist.
title: Dear Comrades!

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Dear Comrades! presents a politically driven story, but it was backed by the Russian state and has significant government involvement, making it not strictly independent. Despite its artistic approach and historical exploration, the state's role in its production and distribution moves it into a more mainstream category.

overview: In August 1961, speleologists from Italy’s booming North arrive on a Calabrian plateau where time stands still. The intruders discover one of the world’s deepest caves, the Bifurto Abyss, under the gaze of an old shepherd, the only witness of the pristine territory.
title: Il Buco

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Il buco is an independent film due to its small-scale production, low-budget approach, and its focus on naturalistic storytelling. Michelangelo Frammartino’s direction and the minimalistic style of the film, alongside the lack of significant studio backing, contribute to its status as independent cinema.

overview: Iranian director Jafar Panahi, who has been barred from leaving the country, arrives at a village on the Iran-Turkey border to supervise a film based on a real-life couple seeking passports to Europe being shot in Turkey, but both his stay and the production run into trouble.
title: No Bears

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: No Bears is an independent film, despite the political and logistical difficulties Jafar Panahi faced during its production. The film was created without major studio backing and reflects Panahi’s auteur-driven style. It was made under restricted conditions in Iran, which further strengthens its status as independent cinema.

overview: In the treacherous and swampy forests that make up the so called “green border” between Belarus and Poland, refugees from the Middle East and Africa trying to reach the European Union are trapped in a geopolitical crisis cynically engineered by Belarusian dictator Alexander Lukashenko. In an attempt to provoke Europe, refugees are lured to the border by propaganda promising easy passage to the EU. Pawns in this hidden war, the lives of Julia, a newly minted activist who has given up her comfortable life, Jan, a young border guard, and a Syrian family intertwine.
title: Green Border

infoIndieAndAwards.noteOnIndie: Green Border is an independent film due to its critical approach to the European migration crisis and its unconventional production methods. While it involved several European countries, it was not financed by major commercial studios, and its emphasis on storytelling over commercial appeal supports its independent status.

April is an independent film due to its focus on personal and societal themes, with a production style that prioritizes artistic vision over commercial interests. The film was funded through smaller co-productions and aims to explore deep and intimate issues, hallmarks of independent cinema.
